properties.Name: Reference
properties.Definition: Reference ID for this specified type in this project (e.g. type 'A-1')

properties.Name: NumberOfRiser
properties.Definition: Total number of the risers included in the stair flight

properties.Name: NumberOfTreads
properties.Definition: Total number of treads included in the stair flight

properties.Name: RiserHeight
properties.Definition:
Vertical distance from tread to tread. 
The riser height is supposed to be equal for all steps of a stair or stair flight.

properties.Name: TreadLength
properties.Definition:
Horizontal distance from the front of the thread to the front of the next tread. 
The tread length is supposed to be equal for all steps of the stair or stair flight at the walking line.

properties.Name: NosingLength
properties.Definition: Horizontal distance from the front of the tread to the riser underneath. It is the overhang of the tread.

properties.Name: WalkingLineOffset
properties.Definition:
Offset of the walking line from the inner side of the flight. 
Note: the walking line may have a own shape representation (in case of inconsistencies, the value derived from the shape representation shall take precedence).

properties.Name: TreadLengthAtOffset
properties.Definition:
Length of treads at a given offset.
Walking line position is given by the 'WalkingLineOffset'. The resulting value should normally be identical with TreadLength, it may be given in addition, if the walking line offset for building code calculations is different from that used in design.

properties.Name: TreadLengthAtInnerSide
properties.Definition:
Minimum length of treads at the inner side of the winder. 
Only relevant in case of winding flights, for straight flights it is identical with IfcStairFlight.TreadLength. It is a pre-calculated value, in case of inconsistencies, the value derived from the shape representation shall take precedence.

properties.Name: Headroom
properties.Definition:
Actual headroom clearance for the passageway according to the current design. 
The shape information is provided in addition to the shape representation and the geometric parameters used within. In cases of inconsistency between the geometric parameters and the shape properties, provided in the attached property, the geometric parameters take precedence.

properties.Name: WaistThickness
properties.Definition: Minimum thickness of the stair flight, measured perpendicular to the slope of the flight to the inner corner of riser and tread. It is a pre-calculated value, in case of inconsistencies, the value derived from the shape representation shall take precedence.

properties.Name: ChangeDescription
properties.Definition: A general description of the change.

properties.Name: ReasonForChange
properties.Definition: A description of the problem for why a change is needed.

properties.Name: BudgetSource
properties.Definition: The budget source requested.

properties.Name: DischargePosition
properties.Definition:
Centrifugal fan discharge position:
TOPHORIZONTAL: Top horizontal discharge. 
TOPANGULARDOWN: Top angular down discharge. 
DOWNBLAST: Downblast discharge. 
BOTTOMANGULARDOWN: Bottom angular down discharge. 
BOTTOMHORIZONTAL: Bottom horizontal discharge. 
BOTTOMANGULARUP: Bottom angular up discharge. 
UPBLAST: Upblast discharge. 
TOPANGULARUP: Top angular up discharge. 
OTHER: Other type of fan arrangement.

properties.Name: DirectionOfRotation
properties.Definition:
The direction of the centrifugal fan wheel rotation when viewed from the drive side of the fan:
CLOCKWISE: Clockwise. 
COUNTERCLOCKWISE: Counter-clockwise. 
OTHER: Other type of fan rotation.

properties.Name: Arrangement
properties.Definition:
Defines the fan and motor drive arrangement as defined by AMCA:
ARRANGEMENT1: Arrangement 1. 
ARRANGEMENT2: Arrangement 2. 
ARRANGEMENT3: Arrangement 3. 
ARRANGEMENT4: Arrangement 4. 
ARRANGEMENT7: Arrangement 7. 
ARRANGEMENT8: Arrangement 8. 
ARRANGEMENT9: Arrangement 9. 
ARRANGEMENT10: Arrangement 10. 
OTHER: Other type of fan drive arrangement.

properties.Name: NominalSumpLength
properties.Definition: Nominal or quoted length measured along the x-axis in the local coordinate system or the radius (in the case of a circular shape in plan) of the sump.

properties.Name: NominalSumpWidth
properties.Definition: Nominal or quoted length measured along the y-axis in the local coordinate system of the sump.

properties.Name: NominalSumpDepth
properties.Definition: Nominal or quoted length measured along the z-axis in the local coordinate system of the sump.

properties.Name: SumpMaterial
properties.Definition: The primary material used to construct the object

properties.Name: GullyType
properties.Definition: Identifies the predefined types of gully from which the type required may be set.

properties.Name: TrapType
properties.Definition: Identifies the predefined types of trap from which the type required may be set.

properties.Name: OutletConnectionSize
properties.Definition: Size of the outlet connection from the object

properties.Name: BackInletPatternType
properties.Definition:
Identifies the pattern of inlet connections to a gully trap.

A gulley trap may have 0,1,2,3 or 4 inlet connections and the pattern of their arrangement may vary. The enumeration makes the convention that an outlet is either vertical or is placed at the bottom (south side) of the gully trap (when viewed in plan). Position 1 is to the left (west), position 2 is to the top (north), position 3 is to the right (east) and position 4 is to the bottom (south).

               2
               |
   ----------------
   !                       |
1-|                       |-3
   !                       |
   ----------------
               |
              4

properties.Name: InletConnectionSize
properties.Definition:
Size of the inlet connection(s), where used, of the inlet connections.

Note that all inlet connections are assumed to be the same size.

properties.Name: CoverLength
properties.Definition: The length measured along the x-axis in the local coordinate system or the radius (in the case of a circular shape in plan) of the cover of the gully trap.

properties.Name: CoverWidth
properties.Definition: The length measured along the y-axis in the local coordinate system of the cover of the gully trap.

properties.Name: CoverMaterial
properties.Definition: Material from which the object is constructed.

properties.Name: Spacing
properties.Definition: Distance between fins on a tube in the tube bundle.

properties.Name: Thickness
properties.Definition: Thickness of the fin.

properties.Name: ThermalConductivity
properties.Definition: The thermal conductivity of the fin.

properties.Name: Length
properties.Definition: Length of the fin as measured parallel to the direction of airflow.

properties.Name: Height
properties.Definition: Length of the fin as measured perpendicular to the direction of airflow.

properties.Name: Diameter
properties.Definition: Actual diameter of a fin for circular fins only.

properties.Name: Material
properties.Definition: Material used for construction of the fins.

properties.Name: FinCorrugatedType
properties.Definition: Description of a fin corrugated type.

properties.Name: HasCoating
properties.Definition: TRUE if the fin has a coating, FALSE if it does not.

properties.Name: SoundSensorSetPoint
properties.Definition: The sound pressure value to be sensed.

properties.Name: SoundSensorRange
properties.Definition: The upper and lower bounds for operation of the sound sensor.

properties.Name: SoundSensorAccuracy
properties.Definition: The accuracy of the sensor.

properties.Name: TimeConstant
properties.Definition:
The time constant of the sensor.
.

properties.Name: TotalCoolingLoad
properties.Definition: The peak total cooling load for the building, zone or space.

properties.Name: TotalHeatingLoad
properties.Definition: The peak total heating load for the building, zone or space.

properties.Name: LightingDiversity
properties.Definition: Lighting diversity.

properties.Name: InfiltrationDiversitySummer
properties.Definition: Diversity factor for Summer infiltration.

properties.Name: InfiltrationDiversityWinter
properties.Definition: Diversity factor for Winter infiltration.

properties.Name: ApplianceDiversity
properties.Definition: Diversity of appliance load.

properties.Name: LoadSafetyFactor
properties.Definition: Load safety factor.

properties.Name: GasBurnerType
properties.Definition: Selection of the type of gas burner from the enumerated list of types

properties.Name: WorksurfaceArea
properties.Definition: The value of the work surface area of the desk.

properties.Name: SubType
properties.Definition: Subtype of fitting (I.e., 5-gore, pleated, stamped, etc.)

properties.Name: Material
properties.Definition: The duct fitting material.

properties.Name: MaterialThickness
properties.Definition: The thickness of the duct fitting material.

properties.Name: PressureClass
properties.Definition: Pressure classification as defined by the authority having jurisdiction (e.g., SMACNA, etc.).

properties.Name: UnitWeight
properties.Definition: Weight per unit length.

properties.Name: PressureRange
properties.Definition: Allowable maximum and minimum working pressure (relative to ambient pressure).

properties.Name: TemperatureRange
properties.Definition: Allowable maximum and minimum temperature.

properties.Name: NominalDiameterOrWidth
properties.Definition: The nominal diameter or width of the duct fitting. If the list contains only one value, then this nominal diameter or width applies to all ports. For more than value in the list, the nominal diameter or width value applies to the port that corresponds to the list index.

properties.Name: NominalHeight
properties.Definition: The nominal height of the duct fitting. Refer to NominalDiameterOrWidth for comments about interpretation of multiple items in the list.

properties.Name: EndStyleTreatment
properties.Definition:
The end-style treatment of the duct fitting manufactured. If the list contains only one value, then this end-style applies to all ports. For more than one value in the list, the end-style value applies to the port that corresponds to the list index.The following suggested items should be utilized whenever possible for correlation with port enumerations:
ANGLE: Angle. 
BEADEDSLEEVE: Beaded Sleeve. 
BRAZED: Brazed. 
COMPRESSION: Compression. 
CRIMP: Crimp. 
DRAWBAND: Drawband. 
DRIVESLIP: Drive slip. 
FLANGED: Flanged. 
OUTSIDESLEEVE: Outside Sleeve. 
SLIPON: Slipon. 
SOLDERED: Soldered. 
SSLIP: S-Slip. 
STANDINGSEAM: Standing seam. 
SWEDGE: Swedge. 
WELDED: Welded. 
NONE: No end-style treatment has been applied.
NOTDEFINED: Undefined end-style type.

properties.Name: PressureRating
properties.Definition: Nominal pressure rating of the boiler as rated by ASME Boiler and Pressure Vessel Code Section IV, Rules for Construction of Heating Boilers, and Section I, Rules for Construction of Power Boilers

properties.Name: OperatingMode
properties.Definition: Identifies the operating mode of the boiler.

properties.Name: Material
properties.Definition: The primary material used to construct the boiler's heat transfer vessel.

properties.Name: HeatTransferSurfaceArea
properties.Definition: Total heat transfer area of the vessel.

properties.Name: NominalPartLoadRatio
properties.Definition: Allowable part load ratio range.

properties.Name: WaterInletTemperatureRange
properties.Definition: Allowable water inlet temperature range.

properties.Name: WaterStorageCapacity
properties.Definition: Water storage capacity.

properties.Name: IsWaterStorageHeater
properties.Definition: This is used to identify if the boiler has storage capacity (TRUE). If FALSE, then there is no storage capacity built into the boiler, such as an instantaneous hot water heater.

properties.Name: Weight
properties.Definition: Weight of the boiler.

properties.Name: PartialLoadEfficiencyCurves
properties.Definition: Boiler efficiency as a function of the partial load factor; E = f (partialLaodfactor).

properties.Name: NominalEfficiency
properties.Definition: The nominal efficiency of the boiler as defined by the manufacturer. For water boilers, a function of inlet versus outlet temperature. For steam boilers, a function of inlet temperature versus steam pressure.

properties.Name: HeatOutput
properties.Definition: Total nominal heat output as listed by the Boiler manufacturer. For water boilers, it is a function of inlet versus outlet temperature. For steam boilers, it is a function of inlet temperature versus steam pressure.

properties.Name: OutletTemperatureRange
properties.Definition: Allowable outlet temperature of either the water or the steam.

properties.Name: NominalEnergyConsumption
properties.Definition: Nominal fuel consumption rate required to produce the total boiler heat output.

properties.Name: FireHydrantType
properties.Definition:
Defines the range of hydrant types from which the required type can be selected where:

DryBarrel =	 A hydrant that has isolating valves fitted below ground and that may be used where the possibility of water freezing is a consideration.
WetBarrel =	 A hydrant that has isolating valves fitted above ground and that may be used where there is no possibility of water freezing.

properties.Name: PumperConnectionSize
properties.Definition: The size of a connection to which a fire hose may be connected that is then linked to a pumping unit.

properties.Name: NumberOfHoseConnections
properties.Definition: The number of hose connections on the hydrant (excluding the pumper connection)

properties.Name: HoseConnectionSize
properties.Definition: The size of connections to which a hose may be connected (other than that to be linked to a pumping unit).

properties.Name: DischargeFlowRate
properties.Definition: The volumetric rate of fluid discharge.

properties.Name: FlowClass
properties.Definition: Alphanumeric indication of the flow class of a hydrant (may be used in connection with or instead of the FlowRate property)

properties.Name: WaterIsPotable
properties.Definition: Indication of whether the water flow from the hydrant is potable (set TRUE) or non potable (set FALSE)

properties.Name: PressureRating
properties.Definition: Maximum pressure that the hydrant is manufactured to withstand.

properties.Name: BodyColor
properties.Definition:
Color of the body of the hydrant.

Note: Consult local fire regulations for statutory colors that may be required for hydrant bodies in particular circumstances.

properties.Name: CapColor
properties.Definition:
Color of the caps of the hydrant.

Note: Consult local fire regulations for statutory colors that may be required for hydrant caps in particular circumstances.

properties.Name: HighLimit
properties.Definition: The high limit value for the analog input.

properties.Name: LowLimit
properties.Definition: The low limit value for the analog input.

properties.Name: Deadband
properties.Definition: The deadband value for the analog input.

properties.Name: HighLimitEnable
properties.Definition: Is high limit validation enabled (TRUE) or not (FALSE).

properties.Name: LowLimitEnable
properties.Definition: Is low limit validation enabled (TRUE) or not (FALSE).

properties.Name: EventEnable
properties.Definition: Enumeration that defines the type of event enabling

properties.Name: NotifyType
properties.Definition: Enumeration that defines the notification type

properties.Name: Reference
properties.Definition: Reference ID for this specified type in this project (e.g. type 'A-1')

properties.Name: Span
properties.Definition:
Clear span for this object.
The shape information is provided in addition to the shape representation and the geometric parameters used within. In cases of inconsistency between the geometric parameters and the shape properties, provided in the attached property, the geometric parameters take precedence.

properties.Name: Slope
properties.Definition:
Slope angle - relative to horizontal (0.0 degrees).
The shape information is provided in addition to the shape representation and the geometric parameters used within. In cases of inconsistency between the geometric parameters and the shape properties, provided in the attached property, the geometric parameters take precedence.

properties.Name: IsExternal
properties.Definition: Indication whether the element is designed for use in the exterior (TRUE) or not (FALSE). If (TRUE) it is an external element and faces the outside of the building.

properties.Name: LoadBearing
properties.Definition: Indicates whether the object is intended to carry loads (TRUE) or not (FALSE).

properties.Name: FireRating
properties.Definition:
Fire rating for this object.
It is given according to the national fire safety classification.

properties.Name: Reference
properties.Definition: Reference ID for this specified type in this project (e.g. type 'A-1')

properties.Name: AcousticRating
properties.Definition:
Acoustic rating for this object.
It is giving according to the national building code. It indicates the sound transmission resistance of this object by an index ration (instead of providing full sound absorbtion values).

properties.Name: FireRating
properties.Definition: Fire rating given according to the national fire safety classification.

properties.Name: Combustible
properties.Definition: Indication whether the object is made from combustible material (TRUE) or not (FALSE).

properties.Name: SurfaceSpreadOfFlame
properties.Definition:
Indication on how the flames spread around the surface,
It is given according to the national building code that governs the fire behaviour for materials.

properties.Name: ThermalTransmittance
properties.Definition:
Thermal transmittance coefficient (U-Value) of a material.
Here the total thermal transmittance coefficient through the wall (including all materials).

properties.Name: IsExternal
properties.Definition: Indication whether the element is designed for use in the exterior (TRUE) or not (FALSE). If (TRUE) it is an external element and faces the outside of the building.

properties.Name: ExtendToStructure
properties.Definition: Indicates whether the object extend to the structure above (TRUE) or not (FALSE).

properties.Name: LoadBearing
properties.Definition: Indicates whether the object is intended to carry loads (TRUE) or not (FALSE).

properties.Name: Compartmentation
properties.Definition: Indication whether the object is designed to serve as a fire compartmentation (TRUE) or not (FALSE).

properties.Name: RiskType
properties.Definition: Identifies the predefined types of risk from which the type required may be set.

properties.Name: NatureOfRisk
properties.Definition:
An indication of the generic nature of the risk that might be encountered. 

NOTE: It is anticipated that there will be a local agreement that constrains the values that might be assigned to this property. An example might be 'Fall'  or 'Fall of grille unit' causing injury and damage to person and property

properties.Name: SubNatureOfRisk1
properties.Definition:
A first subsidiary value that might be assigned to designate a more specific type of risk.

NOTE: Nature of risk may be identified in various ways depending upon the place where risk assessment takes place and according to local agreement. This property set allows for a generic nature of risk and up to two subsidiary natures. An example might be 'causing injury and damage'

properties.Name: SubNatureOfRisk2
properties.Definition: A second subsidiary value that might be assigned to designate a more specific type of risk. An example might be 'o person and property'

properties.Name: RiskCause
properties.Definition: A value that may be assigned to capture the cause or trigger for the risk. An example might be 'poor fixing'

properties.Name: AssessmentOfRisk
properties.Definition:
Likelihood of risk event occurring.

Note  that assessment of risk may frequently be associated with the physical location of the object for which the risk is assessed.

properties.Name: RiskConsequence
properties.Definition: Indicates the level of severity of the consequences that the risk would have in case it happens

properties.Name: RiskRating
properties.Definition: A general rating of the risk that may be determined from a combination of the risk assessment and risk consequence

properties.Name: RiskOwner
properties.Definition: A determination of who is the owner of the risk by reference to principal roles of organizations within a project. Determination of the specific organization should be by reference to instances of IfcActorRole assigned to instances of IfcOrganization (if assigned).

properties.Name: AffectsSurroundings
properties.Definition:
Indicates wether the risk affects only to the person assigned to that task (FALSE) or if it can also affect to the people in the surroundings (TRUE).

For example, the process of painting would affect all the people in the vicinity of the process

properties.Name: PreventiveMeassures
properties.Definition: Identifies preventive measures to be taken to mitigate risk

properties.Name: BuildableArea
properties.Definition: The area of utilization expressed as a minimum value and a maximum value  - according to local building codes.

properties.Name: TotalArea
properties.Definition: Total area of the site - masured according to local building codes.

properties.Name: BuildingHeightLimit
properties.Definition: Calculated maximum height of buildings on this site - according to local building codes.

properties.Name: Diversity
properties.Definition: A factor that is a means of reducing the cable size on the basis that not all the connected load will be drawing current simultaneously.

properties.Name: NumberOfPhases
properties.Definition: Number of phases within this circuit.

properties.Name: MaximumAllowedVoltageDrop
properties.Definition: The maximum voltage drop across the circuit that must not be exceeded.

properties.Name: NetImpedance
properties.Definition: The maximum earth loop impedance of a circuit (typically stated as the variable Zs)

properties.Name: NumberOfRows
properties.Definition: Number of tube rows in the tube bundle assembly.

properties.Name: StaggeredRowSpacing
properties.Definition: Staggered tube row spacing.

properties.Name: InLineRowSpacing
properties.Definition: In-line tube row spacing.

properties.Name: NumberOfCircuits
properties.Definition: Number of parallel fluid tube circuits.

properties.Name: FoulingFactor
properties.Definition: Fouling factor of the tubes in the tube bundle.

properties.Name: ThermalConductivity
properties.Definition: The thermal conductivity of the tube.

properties.Name: Length
properties.Definition: Length of the tubes in the tube bundle.

properties.Name: Volume
properties.Definition: Total volume of fluid in the tubes and their headers.

properties.Name: NominalDiameter
properties.Definition: Nominal diameter or width of the tubes in the tube bundle.

properties.Name: OutsideDiameter
properties.Definition: Actual outside diameter of the tube in the tube bundle.

properties.Name: InsideDiameter
properties.Definition: Actual inner diameter of the tube in the tube bundle.

properties.Name: HorizontalSpacing
properties.Definition: Horizontal spacing between tubes in the tube bundle.

properties.Name: VerticalSpacing
properties.Definition: Vertical spacing between tubes in the tube bundle.

properties.Name: Material
properties.Definition: Material used for construction of the tubes.

properties.Name: HasTurbulator
properties.Definition: TRUE if the tube has a turbulator, FALSE if it does not.

properties.Name: IsAutomatic
properties.Definition: Indication of whether the valve is automatically operated (TRUE) or manually operated (FALSE)

properties.Name: FaceType
properties.Definition: Identifies how the terminal face of an AirTerminal is constructed.

properties.Name: PatternType
properties.Definition: Defines the types of pattern (or shape of a tank that may be specified.

properties.Name: EndShapeType
properties.Definition: Defines the types of end shapes that can be used for preformed tanks. The convention for reading these enumerated values is that for a vertical cylinder, the first value is the base and the second is the top; for a horizontal cylinder, the order of reading should be left to right. For a speherical tank, the value UNSET should be used.

properties.Name: FirstCurvatureRadius
properties.Definition: FirstCurvatureRadius should be defined as the base or left side radius of curvature value.

properties.Name: SecondCurvatureRadius
properties.Definition: SecondCurvatureRadius should be defined as the top or right side radius of curvature value.

properties.Name: TypeDesignator
properties.Definition: Type designator for the precast concrete element. The content depends on local standards. For instance in Finland it usually a one-letter acronym, e.g. P=Column, K=reinforced concrete beam,etc.

properties.Name: ProductionLotId
properties.Definition: The manufacturer's production lot identifier.

properties.Name: SerialNumber
properties.Definition: The manufacturer's serial number for the precast concrete element.

properties.Name: ElementWeight
properties.Definition: The weight of the concrete element. Usually expressed in kg.

properties.Name: ElementGrossVolume
properties.Definition: The gross volume of concrete element. Usually expressed in cubic metre (m3).

properties.Name: ElementNetVolume
properties.Definition: The net volume of concrete element. Openings, voids, chamfers, etc. are subtracted from the gross volume. Usually expressed in cubic metre (m3).

properties.Name: CornerChamfer
properties.Definition: The chamfer in the corners of the precast element. The chamfer is presumed to be equal in both directions.

properties.Name: ManufacturingToleranceClass
properties.Definition: Classification designation of the manufacturing tolerances according to local standards.

properties.Name: FormStrippingStrength
properties.Definition: The minimum required compressive strength of the concrete at form stripping time.

properties.Name: LiftingStrength
properties.Definition: The minimum required compressive strength of the concrete when the concrete element is lifted.

properties.Name: ReleaseStrength
properties.Definition: The minimum required compressive strength of the concrete when the tendon stress is released. This property applies to prestressed concrete elements only.

properties.Name: MinimumAllowableSupportLength
properties.Definition: The minimum allowable support length.

properties.Name: InitialTension
properties.Definition: The initial stress of the tendon. This property applies to prestressed concrete elements only.

properties.Name: TendonRelaxation
properties.Definition: The maximum allowable relaxation of the tendon (usually expressed as %/1000 h).This property applies to prestressed concrete elements only.

properties.Name: TransportationStrength
properties.Definition: The minimum required compressive strength of the concrete required for transportation.

properties.Name: SupportDuringTransportDescription
properties.Definition: Textual description of how the concrete element is supported during transportation

properties.Name: SupportDuringTransportDocReference
properties.Definition: Reference to an external document defining how the concrete element is supported during transportation

properties.Name: HollowCorePlugging
properties.Definition: A descriptive label for how the hollow core ends are treated: they may be left open, closed with a plug, or sealed with cast concrete. Values would be, for example: 'Unplugged', 'Plugged', 'SealedWithConcrete'. This property applies to  hollow core slabs only.

properties.Name: NominalLength
properties.Definition: The nominal length of the segment.

properties.Name: NominalWidth
properties.Definition: The nominal width of the segment

properties.Name: NominalHeight
properties.Definition: The nominal height of the segment

properties.Name: HasCover
properties.Definition: Indication of whether the cable tray has a cover (=TRUE) or not (= FALSE). By default, this value should be set to FALSE.

properties.Name: UpstreamPressure
properties.Definition: The operating pressure of the fluid upstream of the pressure reducing valve

properties.Name: DownstreamPressure
properties.Definition: The operating pressure of the fluid downstream of the pressure reducing valve

properties.Name: GasDetected
properties.Definition: Identification of the gas that is being detected.

properties.Name: GasSensorSetPoint
properties.Definition: The gas concentration value to be sensed.

properties.Name: GasSensorRange
properties.Definition: The upper and lower bounds of gas concentration for operation of the gas sensor.

properties.Name: AccuracyOfGasSensor
properties.Definition: The accuracy of the sensor

properties.Name: TimeConstant
properties.Definition:
The time constant of the sensor
.

properties.Name: ShowerType
properties.Definition:
Selection of the type of shower from the enumerated list of types where:-

Drench = 	Shower that rapidly gives a thorough soaking in an emergency
Individual =	Shower unit that is typically enclosed and is for the use of one person at a time
Tunnel =  	Shower that has a succession of shower heads or spreaders that operate simultaneously along its length

properties.Name: HasTray
properties.Definition: Indicates whether the shower has a separate receptacle that catches the water in a shower and directs it to a waste outlet.

properties.Name: NominalLength
properties.Definition: Nominal or quoted length of the object.

properties.Name: NominalWidth
properties.Definition: Nominal or quoted width of the object.

properties.Name: NominalDepth
properties.Definition: Nominal or quoted depth of the object.

properties.Name: Material
properties.Definition: Material from which the object is constructed

properties.Name: MaterialThickness
properties.Definition: Thickness of the material from which the object is constructed

properties.Name: Color
properties.Definition: Color selection for this object

properties.Name: ShowerHeadDescription
properties.Definition: A description of the shower head(s) that emit the spray of water

properties.Name: DrainSize
properties.Definition: The size of the drain outlet connection from the object

properties.Name: TotalCoolingCapacity
properties.Definition: Total cooling capacity. This includes cooling capacity of beam and cooling capacity of supply air

properties.Name: TotalHeatingCapacity
properties.Definition: Total heating capacity. This includes heating capacity of beam and heating capacity of supply air

properties.Name: BeamCoolingCapacity
properties.Definition: Cooling capacity of beam. This excludes cooling capacity of supply air

properties.Name: BeamHeatingCapacity
properties.Definition: Heating capacity of beam. This excludes heating capacity of supply air

properties.Name: CoolingWaterFlowRate
properties.Definition: Water flow rate for cooling

properties.Name: HeatingWaterFlowRate
properties.Definition: Water flow rate for heating

properties.Name: CorrectionFactorForCooling
properties.Definition: Correction factor k as a function of water flow rate (used to calculate cooling capacity)

properties.Name: CorrectionFactorForHeating
properties.Definition: Correction factor k as a function of water flow rate (used to calculate heating capacity)

properties.Name: WaterPressureDropCurves
properties.Definition: Water pressure drop as function of water flow rate

properties.Name: SupplyWaterTemperatureCooling
properties.Definition: Supply water temperature in cooling mode

properties.Name: ReturnWaterTemperatureCooling
properties.Definition: Return water temperature in cooling mode

properties.Name: SupplyWaterTemperatureHeating
properties.Definition: Supply water temperature in heating mode

properties.Name: ReturnWaterTemperatureHeating
properties.Definition: Return water temperature in heating mode

properties.Name: UsePurpose
properties.Definition: The principal purpose for which the work surface is intended to be used e.g. writing/reading, computer, meeting, printer, reference files, etc.

properties.Name: SupportType
properties.Definition: Available support types from which that required may be selected.

properties.Name: HangingHeight
properties.Definition: The hanging height of the worksurface.

properties.Name: NominalThickness
properties.Definition: The nominal thickness of the work surface.

properties.Name: ShapeDescription
properties.Definition: A description of the shape of the work surface e.g. corner square, rectangle, etc.

properties.Name: NumberOfPanels
properties.Definition: Number of panels.

properties.Name: ContactorType
properties.Definition:
A list of the available types of contactor from which that required may be selected where:

CapacitorSwitching - for switching 3 phase single or multi-step capacitor banks
LowCurrent - requires the use of low resistance contacts
MagneticLatching - enables the contactor to remain in the on position when the coil is no longer energized
MechanicalLatching - requires that the contactor is mechanically retained in the on position
Modular - are totally enclosed and self contained
Reversing - has a double set of contactors that are prewired
Standard - is a generic device that controls the flow of power in a circuit on or off

properties.Name: NominalLength
properties.Definition: The nominal length of the segment.

properties.Name: NominalWidth
properties.Definition: The nominal width of the segment

properties.Name: NominalHeight
properties.Definition: The nominal height of the segment

properties.Name: LadderConfiguration
properties.Definition: Description of the configuration of the ladder structure used.

properties.Name: InteriorRoughnessCoefficient
properties.Definition: The interior roughness of the pipe fitting material.

properties.Name: Color
properties.Definition:
The color of the pipe fitting.

Note: This is typically used only for plastic pipe fittings. However, it may be used for any pipe fittings with a painted surface which is not otherwise specified as a covering.

properties.Name: MinimumTextHeight
properties.Definition: The minlimum height of this type.

properties.Name: SelfTestFunction
properties.Definition: The type of self test function.

properties.Name: BackupSupplySystem
properties.Definition: The type of backup supply system.

properties.Name: PictogramEscapeDirection
properties.Definition: The direction of escape pictogram.

properties.Name: Addressablility

properties.Name: ConnectionType
properties.Definition:
The connection type between pipe segments or fittings and other segments or fittings. If the list contains only one value, then this connection type value applies to all ports. For more than one value in the list, the connection type value applies to the port that corresponds to the list index.The following suggested items should be utilized whenever possible for correlation with port enumerations:
BRAZED: Brazed connection type. 
COMPRESSION: Compression connection type. 
FLANGED: Flanged connection type including bolts and gasket. 
GLANDJOINT: Gland-joint  connection type. 
FLEXIBLEBOLTEDGLANDJOINT: Flexible bolted gland-joint  connection type. 
FLEXIBLEBOLTEDGLANDJOINTWITHANODEENDCAP: Flexible bolted gland-joint with anode end-cap connection type.  
GROOVED: Grooved connection type. 
SOLDERED: Soldered connection type. 
SOLDERED_FEMALE: Female-soldered connection type. 
SOLDERED_MALE: Male-soldered connection type. 
SWEDGE: Swedge connection type.  
THREADED: Threaded connection type. 
THREADED_FEMALE: Female-threaded connection type. 
THREADED_MALE: Male-threaded connection type. 
WELDED: Welded connection type. 
WELDED_BUTT: Butt-welded connection type. 
WELDED_BRANCH: Branch-welded connection type. 
WELDED_FLANGE: Flange-welded connection type. 
NONE: There is no connection.
NOTDEFINED: Undefined connection type.

properties.Name: CircuitType
properties.Definition:
OpenCircuit: Exposes water directly to the cooling atmosphere.
CloseCircuit: The fluid is separated from the atmosphere by a heat exchanger.
Wet: The air stream or the heat exchange surface is evaporatively cooled.
Dry: No evaporation into the air stream.
DryWet: A combination of a dry tower and a wet tower.

CounterFlow: Air and water flow enter in different directions.
CrossFlow: Air and water flow are perpendicular.
ParallelFlow: air and water flow enter in same directions.

SprayFilled: Water is sprayed into airflow.
SplashTypeFill: water cascades over successive rows of splash bars.
FilmTypeFill: water flows in a thin layer over closely spaced sheets.

properties.Definition:
FanCycling: Fan is cycled on and off to control duty.
TwoSpeedFan: Fan is switched between low and high speed to control duty.
VariableSpeedFan: Fan speed is varied to control duty.
DampersControl: Dampers modulate the air flow to control duty.
BypassValveControl: Bypass valve modulates the water flow to control duty.
MultipleSeriesPumps: Turn on/off multiple series pump to control duty.
TwoSpeedPump: Switch between high/low pump speed to control duty.
VariableSpeedPump: vary pump speed to control duty

properties.Name: FanEfficiency

properties.Name: OverallEfficiency

properties.Name: ShaftPowerRate
properties.Definition: Fan shaft power.

properties.Definition: Pressure rise = f (flow rate).

properties.Definition: Fan efficiency =f (flow rate).

Identifies the predefined types of permits that can be granted where:

Access = enables access to an identified area,
Work = enables work to be carried out in an identified area

properties.Definition:
Indicates whether or not an escort is required to accompany persons carrying out a work order at or to/from the place of work (= TRUE) or not (= FALSE).

NOTE - There are many instances where escorting is required, particularly in a facility that has a high security rating. Escorting may require that persons are escorted to and from the place of work. Alternatively, it may involve the escort remaining at the place of work at all times.

properties.Name: StartDate

properties.Name: PermitDuration

Any additional special requirements that need to be included in the permit to work.

NOTE - Additional permit requirements may be imposed according to the nature of the facility at which the work is carried out. For instance, in clean areas, special clothing may be required whilst in corrective institutions, it may be necessary to check in and check out tools that will be used for work as a safety precaution.

properties.Name: FuseDisconnectorType
properties.Definition:
A list of the available types of fuse disconnector from which that required may be selected where:

EngineProtectionDevice - A fuse whose characteristic is specifically designed for the protection of a motor or generator.
FuseSwitchDisconnector - A switch disconnector in which a fuse link or a fuse carrier with fuse link forms the moving contact,
HRC - A standard fuse (High Rupturing Capacity)
OverloadProtectionDevice - A device that disconnects the supply when the operating conditions in an electrically undamaged circuit causes an overcurrent,
SemiconductorFuse - A fuse whose characteristic is specifically designed for the protection of sem-conductor devices.
SwitchDisconnectorFuse - A switch disconnector in which one or more poles have a fuse in series in a composite unit.

properties.Name: ActuationType

properties.Name: ClosureRatingEnum

properties.Name: Sensitivity
properties.Definition: Current leakage to an unwanted leading path during normal operation (IEC 151-14-49)

properties.Name: CompressorCapacity
properties.Definition: The product of the  ideal capacity and the overall volumetric efficiency of the compressor.

properties.Name: EnergyEfficiencyRatio
properties.Definition: Energy efficiency ratio (EER).

properties.Name: CoefficientOfPerformance
properties.Definition: Coefficient of performance (COP).

properties.Name: VolumetricEfficiency
properties.Definition: Ratio of the actual volume of gas entering the compressor to the theoretical displacement of the compressor.

properties.Name: CompressionEfficiency
properties.Definition: Ratio of the work required for isentropic compression of the gas to the work delivered to the gas within the compression volume (as obtained by measurement).

properties.Name: MechanicalEfficiency
properties.Definition: Ratio of the work (as measured) delivered to the gas to the work input to the compressor shaft.

properties.Name: IsentropicEfficiency
properties.Definition: Ratio of the work required for isentropic compression of the gas to work input to the compressor shaft.

properties.Name: CompressorTotalEfficiency
properties.Definition: Ratio of the thermal cooling capacity to electrical input.

properties.Name: ShaftPower
properties.Definition: The actual shaft power input to the compressor.

properties.Name: InputPower
properties.Definition: Input power to the compressor motor.

properties.Name: LubricantPumpHeatGain
properties.Definition: Lubricant pump heat gain.

properties.Name: FrictionHeatGain
properties.Definition: Friction heat gain.

properties.Name: CompressorTotalHeatGain
properties.Definition: Compressor total heat gain.

properties.Name: FullLoadRatioCurve
properties.Definition: Ratio of actual power to full load power as a quadratic function of part load, at certain condensing and evaporating temperature, FracFullLoadPower = f ( PartLoadRatio).

properties.Name: DIN135610ShapeCode
properties.Definition: The bending type code for the specific bending shape as defined in the DIN 1356 Teil 10 standard. Note: depending on the standardized shape different combinations of following parameters a...z are used.

properties.Name: DIN135610ShapeParameter_a
properties.Definition: Bar shape parameter a. Note: this parameter is also used for parameter a0 (shape code B3)

properties.Name: DIN135610ShapeParameter_b
properties.Definition: Bar shape parameter b. Note: this parameter is also used for parameter b0 (shape codes C2 and C3)

properties.Name: DIN135610ShapeParameter_c
properties.Definition: Bar shape parameter c.

properties.Name: DIN135610ShapeParameter_d
properties.Definition: Bar shape parameter d. Note: this parameter is also used for parameter d0 (shape code B3)

properties.Name: DIN135610ShapeParameter_e
properties.Definition: Bar shape parameter e. Note: this parameter is also used for parameter e0 (shape codes A4 and C3)

properties.Name: DIN135610ShapeParameter_z
properties.Definition: Bar shape parameter z.

properties.Name: IsFOB
properties.Definition: Indication of whether contents of the purchase order are delivered 'Free on Board' (= True) or not (= False).

properties.Name: ShipMethod
properties.Definition: Method of shipping that will be used for goods or services.

properties.Name: MoveDescription
properties.Definition: A textual description of the move required.

properties.Name: SpecialInstructions
properties.Definition: Special instructions that affect the move.

properties.Name: SwitchDisconnectorType
properties.Definition:
A list of the available types of switch disconnector from which that required may be selected where:

CenterBreak - A disconnector in which both contacts of each pole are movable and engage at a point substantially midway between their supports. (IEC 441-14-08)
DividedSupport - A disconnector in which the fixed and moving contacts of each pole are not supported by a common base or frame. (IEC 441-14-06)
DoubleBreak - A disconnector that opens a circuit at two points. (IEC 441-14-09)
EarthingSwitch - A disconnector in which the fixed and moving contacts of each pole are not supported by a common base or frame. (IEC 441-14-07)
Isolator - A disconnector which in the open position satisfies isolating requirements. (IEC 441-14-12)

properties.Name: LoadDisconnectionType
properties.Definition: A list of the available types of load disconnection from which that required may be selected.

properties.Name: HasVisualIndication
properties.Definition: Indicates whether a means of being to visually ascertain whether the contacts are open or closed is fitted (= TRUE) or not (= FALSE)

properties.Name: FaceType
properties.Definition: Identifies how the terminal face of an AirTerminal is constructed.

properties.Name: NominalCurrent
properties.Definition: The maximum allowed current that a device is certified to handle.

properties.Name: UsageCurrent
properties.Definition: The current that a device is actually handling or is calculated to be handling at a point in time.

properties.Name: NominalVoltage
properties.Definition: The range of allowed voltage that a device is certified to handle. The upper bound of this value is the maximum.

properties.Name: ElectricalDeviceNominalPower
properties.Definition: The output power rating that is certified for a device.

properties.Name: NumberOfPoles
properties.Definition: The number of logical connections that can be made on an electrical device.

properties.Name: HasProtectiveEarth
properties.Definition: Indicates whether the electrical device has a protective earth connection (=TRUE) or not (= FALSE).

properties.Name: NominalFrequencyRange
properties.Definition: The upper and lower limits of frequency for which the operation of the device is certified.

properties.Name: PhaseAngle
properties.Definition: The angular difference between two waveforms of the same frequency

properties.Name: IP_Code
properties.Definition: IEC 529 (1989) Classification of degrees of protection provided by enclosures (IP Code)

properties.Name: InsulationStandardClass
properties.Definition: Insulation standard classes provides basic protection information against electric shock. Defines levels of insulation required in terms of constructional requirements (creepage and clearance distances) and electrical requirements (compliance with electric strength tests). Basic insulation is considered to be shorted under single fault conditions. The actual values required depend on the working voltage to which the insulation is subjected, as well as other factors. Also indicates whether the electrical device has a protective earth connection.

properties.Name: PhaseReference
properties.Definition: The phase identification used for the device electrical input. This should be the same phase identifier that is used for the conductor segment providing the electrical service to the device. In general, it is recommended that IEC recommendations for phase identification are used (L1, L2 etc.). However, other phase identifiers may be used such as by color (Red, Blue, Yellow) or by number (1, 2, 3) etc.

properties.Name: Reference
properties.Definition: Reference ID for this specified type in this project (e.g. type 'A-1')

properties.Name: Slope
properties.Definition:
Slope angle - relative to horizontal (0.0 degrees).
The shape information is provided in addition to the shape representation and the geometric parameters used within. In cases of inconsistency between the geometric parameters and the shape properties, provided in the attached property, the geometric parameters take precedence.

properties.Name: IsExternal
properties.Definition: Indication whether the element is designed for use in the exterior (TRUE) or not (FALSE). If (TRUE) it is an external element and faces the outside of the building.

properties.Name: LoadBearing
properties.Definition: Indicates whether the object is intended to carry loads (TRUE) or not (FALSE).

properties.Name: FireRating
properties.Definition:
Fire rating for this object.
It is given according to the national fire safety classification.

properties.Name: SensibleEffectiveness
properties.Definition: Sensible heat transfer effectiveness, where effectiveness is defined as the ratio of heat transfer to maximum possible heat transfer.

properties.Name: TotalEffectiveness
properties.Definition: Total heat transfer effectiveness: The ratio of heat transfer to the maximum possible heat transfer.

properties.Name: TemperatureEffectiveness
properties.Definition: Temperature heat transfer effectiveness: The ratio of primary airflow temperature changes to maximum possible temperature changes.

properties.Name: DefrostTemperatureEffectiveness
properties.Definition: Temperature heat transfer effectiveness when defrosting is active.

properties.Name: HumidityEffectiveness
properties.Definition: Humidity heat transfer effectiveness: The ratio of primary airflow absolute humidity changes to maximum possible absolute humidity changes.

properties.Name: SensibleHeatTransferRate
properties.Definition: Sensible heat transfer rate

properties.Name: LatentHeatTransferRate
properties.Definition: Latent heat transfer rate

properties.Name: TotalHeatTransferRate
properties.Definition: Total heat transfer rate

properties.Name: SensibleEffectivenessTable
properties.Definition: Sensible heat transfer effectiveness curve as a function of the primary and secondary air flow rate.

properties.Name: TotalEffectivenessTable
properties.Definition: Total heat transfer effectiveness curve as a function of the primary and secondary air flow rate.

properties.Name: AirPressureDropCurves
properties.Definition: Air pressure drop as function of air flow rate

properties.Name: IsOneWay
properties.Definition: Indicates whether the parking aisle is designed for oneway traffic (TRUE) or twoway traffic (FALSE).

properties.Name: FixingSocketTypeReference
properties.Definition: Type reference for the fixing socket according to local standards.

properties.Name: FixingSocketHeight
properties.Definition: The overall height of the fixing socket.

properties.Name: FixingSocketThreadDiameter
properties.Definition: The nominal diameter of the thread.

properties.Name: FixingSocketThreadLength
properties.Definition: The length of the threaded part of the fixing socket.

properties.Name: VibrationTransmissibility
properties.Definition: The vibration transmissibility percentage.

properties.Name: IsolatorStaticDeflection
properties.Definition: Static deflection of the vibration isolator.

properties.Name: IsolatorCompressibility
properties.Definition: The compressibility of the vibration isolator.

properties.Name: Height
properties.Definition: Height of the vibration isolator before tha application of load.

properties.Name: Material
properties.Definition: Material from which the damping element of the vibration isolator is constructed.

properties.Name: MaximumSupportedWeight
properties.Definition: The maximum weight that can be carried by the vibration isolator.

properties.Name: AbsoluteRoughnessFactor
properties.Definition: The absolute roughness factor of the duct fitting.

properties.Name: HasLiner
properties.Definition: TRUE if the fitting has interior duct insulating lining, FALSE if it does not.

properties.Name: Color
properties.Definition:
The color of the duct fitting.

Note: This is typically used for any duct fittings with a painted surface which is not otherwise specified as a covering.

properties.Name: ProductDescription
properties.Definition: A textual description of the products that require the work.

properties.Name: ShortJobDescription
properties.Definition: Short description of the job requested.

properties.Name: LongJobDescription
properties.Definition: Description of the job requested.

properties.Name: WorkTypeRequested
properties.Definition: Work type requested in circumstances where there are categorizations of types of work task. It could be used to identify a remedial task, minor work task, electrical task etc.

properties.Name: ContractualType
properties.Definition: The contractual type of the work.

properties.Name: IfNotAccomplished
properties.Definition: Comments if the job is not accomplished.

properties.Name: MaintenaceType
properties.Definition:
Identifies the predefined types of maintenance that can be done from which the type that generates the maintenance work order may be set where:

ConditionBased = generated as a result of the condition of an asset or artefact being less than a determined value.
Corrective = generated as a result of an immediate and urgent need for maintenance action.
PlannedCorrective = generated as a result of immediate corrective action being needed but with sufficient time available for the work order to be included in maintenance planning.
Scheduled = generated as a result of a fixed, periodic maintenance requirement.

properties.Name: FaultPriorityType
properties.Definition:
Identifies the predefined types of priority that can be assigned from which the type may be set where:

High = action is required urgently.
Medium = action can occur within a reasonable period of time.
Low = action can occur when convenient.

properties.Name: LocationPriorityType
properties.Definition:
Identifies the predefined types of priority that can be assigned from which the type may be set where:

High = action is required urgently.
Medium = action can occur within a reasonable period of time.
Low = action can occur when convenient.

properties.Name: ScheduledFrequency
properties.Definition: The period of time between expected instantiations of a work order that may have been predefined.

properties.Name: Type
properties.Definition:
Defines the types of tank that may be specified where: 

BreakPressure =	 Tank that breaks the hydraulic pressure in a distribution system
Expansion =	 Tank, connected to the primary circuit of a hot water system that accommodates increase in volume of the water when heated
FeedAndExpansion =	 Tank that supplies cold water to a hot water system and also accommodates increase in volume of the water when heated
GasStorage_Butane =	 Main tank to which commercial butane is delivered and from which it is supplied to a gas distribution system.
GasStorage_LPG =	 Main tank to which liquefied petroleum gas is delivered and from which it is supplied to a gas distribution system.
GasStorage_Propane =	 Main tank to which commercial propane is delivered and from which it is supplied to a gas distribution system.
OilService =	 Secondary tank from which oil fuel is fed to a single oil fuel burning appliance
OilStorage =	 Main tank to which oil fuel is delivered and from which it is supplied to an oil fuel burning appliance or oil service tank.
PressureVessel =  Tank that stores fluid under pressure.
WaterStorage_General =	 Tank that stores water sufficient to meet general requirements for a designated period of time and supplies it to points of outlet
WaterStorage_Potable =	 Tank that stores water sufficient to meet potable water requirements for a designated period of time and supplies it to points of outlet
WaterStorage_Process =	 Tank that stores water sufficient to meet process and/or production requirements for a designated period of time and supplies it to points of outlet
WaterStorage_CoolingTowerMakeup =	 Tank that stores water sufficient to meet cooling tower make up water requirements for a designated period of time and supplies it to points of outlet

properties.Name: AccessType
properties.Definition:
Defines the types of access (or cover) to a tank that may be specified.

Note that covers are generally specified for rectangular tanks. For cylindrical tanks, access will normally be via a manhole.

properties.Name: NominalLengthOrDiameter
properties.Definition: The nominal length or, in the case of a vertical cylindrical tank, the nominal diameter of the tank

properties.Name: NominalWidthOrDiameter
properties.Definition:
The nominal width or, in the case of a horizontal cylindrical tank, the nominal diameter of the tank.

Note: Not required for a vertical cylindrical tank.

properties.Name: NominalDepth
properties.Definition:
The nominal depth of the tank.

Note: Not required for a horizontal cylindrical tank.

properties.Name: NominalCapacity
properties.Definition: The nominal or design volumetric capacity of the tank.

properties.Name: EffectiveCapacity
properties.Definition: The effective or actual volumetric capacity of the tank.

properties.Name: OperatingWeight
properties.Definition: Operating weight of the tank including all of its contents.

properties.Name: Material
properties.Definition: Material from which the tank is constructed.

properties.Name: MaterialThickness
properties.Definition: Thickness of the material from which the tank is constructed

properties.Name: TankComposition
properties.Definition:
Defines the level of element composition where:

COMPLEX = A set of elementary units aggregated together to fulfill the overall  required purpose.
ELEMENT = A single elementary unit that may exist of itself or as an aggregation of partial units..
PARTIAL

properties.Name: HasLadder
properties.Definition:
Indication of whether the tank is provided with a ladder (set TRUE) for access to the top. If no ladder is provided then value is set FALSE.

Note: No indication is given of the type of ladder (gooseneck etc.)

properties.Name: HasVisualIndicator
properties.Definition: Indication of whether the tank is provided with a visual indicator (set TRUE) that shows the water level in the tank. If no visual indicator is provided then value is set FALSE.

properties.Name: AreaDrained
properties.Definition: The area measure enclosed within the catchment

properties.Name: Application
properties.Definition:
Humidifier application.
Fixed: Humidifier installed in a ducted flow distribution system.
Portable: Humidifier is not installed in a ducted flow distribution system.

properties.Name: Weight
properties.Definition: The weight of the humidifier.

properties.Name: NominalMoistureGain
properties.Definition: Nominal rate of water vapor added into the airstream.

properties.Name: NominalAirFlowRate
properties.Definition: Nominal rate of air flow into which water vapor is added.

properties.Name: InternalControl
properties.Definition: Internal modulation control.

properties.Name: WaterRequirement
properties.Definition: Make-up water requirement.

properties.Name: CoolingDesignAirflow
properties.Definition: The air flowrate required during the peak cooling conditions.

properties.Name: HeatingDesignAirflow
properties.Definition: The air flowrate required during the peak heating conditions, but could also be determined by minimum ventilation requirement or minimum air change requirements.

properties.Name: TotalSensibleHeatGain
properties.Definition: The total sensible heat or energy gained by the space during the peak cooling conditions.

properties.Name: TotalHeatGain
properties.Definition: The total amount of heat or energy gained by the space at the time of the space's peak cooling conditions.

properties.Name: TotalHeatLoss
properties.Definition: The total amount of heat or energy lost by the space at the time of the space's peak heating conditions.

properties.Name: CoolingDryBulb
properties.Definition: Inside dry bulb temperature for cooling design

properties.Name: CoolingRelativeHumidity
properties.Definition: Inside relative humidity for cooling design.

properties.Name: HeatingDryBulb
properties.Definition: Inside dry bulb temperature for heating design

properties.Name: HeatingRelativeHumidity
properties.Definition: Inside relative humidity for heating design.

properties.Name: VentilationAirFlowrate
properties.Definition: Ventilation outside air requirement for the space.

properties.Name: ExhaustAirFlowrate
properties.Definition: Design exhaust air flow rate for the space.

properties.Name: CeilingRAPlenum
properties.Definition: Ceiling plenum used for return air or not. TRUE = Yes, FALSE = No.

properties.Name: BoundaryAreaHeatLoss
properties.Definition: Heat loss per unit area for the boundary object. This is a design input value for use in the absence of calculated load data.

properties.Name: ArticleNumber
properties.Definition: Article number or reference that may be applied to a product according to a standard scheme for article number definition (e.g. UN, EAN)

properties.Name: ModelReference
properties.Definition: The name of the manufactured item as used by the manufacturer.

properties.Name: ModelLabel
properties.Definition: The model number and/or unit designator assigned by the manufacturer of the manufactured item.

properties.Name: Manufacturer
properties.Definition: The organization that manufactured and/or assembled the item.

properties.Name: ProductionYear
properties.Definition: The year of production of the manufactured item.

properties.Name: FractionRadiantHeatTransfer
properties.Definition: Fraction of the total heat transfer rate as the radiant heat transfer.

properties.Name: FractionConvectiveHeatTransfer
properties.Definition: Fraction of the total heat transfer rate as the convective heat transfer.

properties.Name: Effectiveness
properties.Definition: Ratio of the real heat transfer rate to the maximum possible heat transfer rate.

properties.Name: SurfaceTemperature
properties.Definition: Average surface temperature of the component.

properties.Name: SpaceAirTemperature
properties.Definition: Dry bulb temperature in the space.

properties.Name: SpaceMeanRadiantTemperature
properties.Definition: Mean radiant temperature in the space.

properties.Name: AuxiliaryEnergySourceConsumption
properties.Definition: Auxiliary energy source consumption.

properties.Name: UACurve
properties.Definition: UA curve as function of ambient temperature and surface temperature; UA = f (Tambient, Tsurface)

properties.Name: OutputCapacityCurve
properties.Definition: Partial output capacity curve (as a function of water temperature); Q = f (Twater).

properties.Name: AirResistanceCurve
properties.Definition: Air resistance curve (w/ fan only); Pressure = f ( flow rate).

properties.Name: Exponent
properties.Definition: Characteristic exponent, slope of log(heat output) vs log (surface temperature minus environmental temperature).

properties.Name: HeatOutputRate
properties.Definition: Overall heat transfer rate.

properties.Name: Temperature
properties.Definition: The temperature of the fuel.

properties.Name: Pressure
properties.Definition: The pressure of the fuel.

properties.Name: Flowrate
properties.Definition: The flowrate of the fuel.

properties.Name: CoverageArea
properties.Definition: The area that is covered by the sensor (typically measured as a circle whose center is at the location of the sensor)

properties.Name: HeatSensorSetPoint
properties.Definition: The temperature value to be sensed.

properties.Name: HeatSensorRange
properties.Definition: The upper and lower bounds for operation of the heat sensor.

properties.Name: HeatSensorAccuracy
properties.Definition: The accuracy of the sensor.

properties.Name: TimeConstant
properties.Definition:
The time constant of the sensor.
.

properties.Name: RequestSourceType
properties.Definition: Identifies the predefined types of sources through which a request can be made.

properties.Name: RequestSourceLabel
properties.Definition:
A specific name or label that further qualifies the identity of a request source. In the event
                of an email, this may be the email address.

properties.Name: RequestSourceName
properties.Definition: The person making the request, where known.

properties.Name: RequestDescription
properties.Definition: The request description as provided.

properties.Name: RequestComments
properties.Definition: Comments that may be made on the request.

properties.Name: Status
properties.Definition:
The status currently assigned to the request where:
                Hold = wait to see if further requests are received before deciding on action,
                NoAction = no action is required on this request,
                Schedule = plan action to take place as part of maintenance or other task planning/scheduling,
                Urgent = take action immediately.

properties.Name: IsUsed
properties.Definition: Indicates whether the element is being used in a workstation (= TRUE) or not.(= FALSE).

properties.Name: GroupCode
properties.Definition: e.g. panels, worksurfaces, storage, etc.

properties.Name: NominalWidth
properties.Definition: The nominal width of the system furniture elements of this type. The size information is provided in addition to the shape representation and the geometric parameters used within. In cases of inconsistency between the geometric parameters and the size properties, provided in the attached property set, the geometric parameters take precedence.

properties.Name: NominalHeight
properties.Definition: The nominal height of the system furniture elements of this type. The size information is provided in addition to the shape representation and the geometric parameters used within. In cases of inconsistency between the geometric parameters and the size properties, provided in the attached property set, the geometric parameters take precedence.

properties.Name: Finishing
properties.Definition: The finishing applied to system furniture elements of this type e.g. walnut, fabric.

properties.Name: AirflowType
properties.Definition: Enumeration defining the functional type of air flow through the terminal.

properties.Name: Location
properties.Definition: Location  (a single type of diffuser can be used for multiple locations); high means close to ceiling.

properties.Name: Width
properties.Definition: The width of the drainage reserve

properties.Name: Arrangement
properties.Definition:
Defines the basic flow arrangements for the heat exchanger:
COUNTERFLOW: Counterflow heat exchanger arrangement. 
CROSSFLOW: Crossflow heat exchanger arrangement. 
PARALLELFLOW: Parallel flow heat exchanger arrangement. 
MULTIPASS: Multipass flow heat exchanger arrangement. 
OTHER: Other type of heat exchanger flow arrangement not defined above.

properties.Name: ShellMaterial
properties.Definition: Material used to construct the shell of the heat exchanger.

properties.Name: Name
properties.Definition: Subject matter for which a value is to be reported.

properties.Name: Category
properties.Definition: A reference to a classification of the degree of aggregation or granularity of topic data such as regional, local etc.

properties.Name: GroupName
properties.Definition: Name of grouping of topics.

properties.Name: Classification
properties.Definition: A reference to a classification of the topic

properties.Name: DemandValue
properties.Definition: Value of the subject matter as determined using an agreed scale for what is required.

properties.Name: DemandThresholdValue
properties.Definition: Value of the subject matter above or below which a special significance is attached.

properties.Name: DemandImportanceValue
properties.Definition: Importance of the topic relative to the importance of other topics.

properties.Name: SupplyEvaluationValue
properties.Definition: Value of the subject matter as determined using an agreed scale for what is provided, or capable of being provided.

properties.Name: GapValue
properties.Definition: Difference determined between the topic demand value and the topic supply evaluation value.

properties.Name: GapValueWeighted
properties.Definition: Difference determined between the topic demand value and the topic supply evaluation value, weighted for topic demand importance value.

properties.Name: SlotWidth
properties.Definition: Slot width.

properties.Name: SlotLength
properties.Definition: Slot length.

properties.Name: NumberOfSlots
properties.Definition: Number of slots.

properties.Name: FragilityRating
properties.Definition:
The level of fragility of the ceiling.
It is giving according to the national building code.

properties.Name: Permeability
properties.Definition:
Ratio of the permeability of the ceiling.
The ration can be used to indicate an open ceiling (that enables identification of whether ceiling construction should be considered as impeding distribution of sprinkler water, light etc. from installations within the ceiling area) .

properties.Name: TileLength
properties.Definition: Length of ceiling tiles. The size information is provided in addition to the shape representation and the geometric parameters used within. In cases of inconsistency between the geometric parameters and the size properties, provided in the attached property set, the geometric parameters take precedence.

properties.Name: TileWidth
properties.Definition: Width of ceiling tiles. The size information is provided in addition to the shape representation and the geometric parameters used within. In cases of inconsistency between the geometric parameters and the size properties, provided in the attached property set, the geometric parameters take precedence.

properties.Name: NominalLength
properties.Definition: The nominal length of the segment.

properties.Name: NominalWidth
properties.Definition: The nominal width of the segment

properties.Name: NominalHeight
properties.Definition: The nominal height of the segment

properties.Name: ConduitShapeType
properties.Definition: The shape of the conduit segment

properties.Name: IsRigid
properties.Definition: Indication of whether the conduit is rigid (= TRUE) or flexible (= FALSE)

properties.Name: HeatOutputPerUnitLength
properties.Definition: The amount of heat output per unit length of heat emitter.

properties.Name: Torque
properties.Definition: Indicates the maximum close-off torque for the actuator.

properties.Name: RangeAngle
properties.Definition: Indicates the maximum rotation the actuator must traverse.

properties.Name: Description
properties.Definition: Description of the reinforcement.

properties.Name: Reference
properties.Definition: A descriptive label for the general reinforcement type.

properties.Name: ReinforcementBarType
properties.Definition: Defines the type of the reinforcement bar.

properties.Name: HoopBarPitch
properties.Definition: The pitch length of the hoop bar.

properties.Name: XDirectionTieHoopBarPitch
properties.Definition: The X direction pitch length of the tie hoop.

properties.Name: XDirectionTieHoopCount
properties.Definition: The number of bars with X direction tie hoop bars.

properties.Name: YDirectionTieHoopBarPitch
properties.Definition: The Y direction pitch length of the tie hoop.

properties.Name: YDirectionTieHoopCount
properties.Definition: The number of bars with Y direction tie hoop bars.

properties.Name: HumiditySetPoint
properties.Definition: The humidity value to be sensed.

properties.Name: HumiditySensorRange
properties.Definition: The upper and lower bounds for operation of the humidity sensor.

properties.Name: AccuracyOfHumiditySensor
properties.Definition: The accuracy of the sensor

properties.Name: TimeConstant
properties.Definition:
The time constant of the sensor
.

properties.Name: MotorEnclosureType
properties.Definition: A list of the available types of motor enclosure from which that required may be selected.

properties.Name: IsGuarded
properties.Definition: Indication of whether the motor enclosure is guarded (= TRUE) or not (= FALSE)

properties.Name: HasPartWinding
properties.Definition: Indication of whether the motor is single speed, i.e. has a single winding (= FALSE) or multi-speed i.e.has part winding (= TRUE)

properties.Name: FrameSize
properties.Definition: Designation of the frame size according to the named range of frame sizes designated at the place of use or according to a given standard.

properties.Name: ElectricMotorEfficiency
properties.Definition: The ratio of output capacity to intake capacity.

properties.Name: StartCurrentFactor
properties.Definition: IEC. Start current factor defines how large the peak starting current will become on the engine. StartCurrentFactor is multiplied to NominalCurrent and to give the start current.

properties.Name: LockedRotorCurrent
properties.Definition: Input current when a motor armature is energized but not rotating.

properties.Name: MaximumPowerOutput
properties.Definition: The maximum output power rating of the engine.

properties.Name: GasFlowRate
properties.Definition: The volumetric flowrate of gas to the gas terminal.

properties.Name: ClearWidth
properties.Definition:
Clear width of the object (elevator). It indicates the distance from the inner surfaces of the elevator car left and right from the elevator door. 
The shape information is provided in addition to the shape representation and the geometric parameters used within. In cases of inconsistency between the geometric parameters and the shape properties, provided in the attached property, the geometric parameters take precedence.

properties.Name: ClearDepth

Clear depth of the object (elevator). It indicates the distance from the inner surface of the elevator door to the opposite surface of the elevator car. 
The shape information is provided in addition to the shape representation and the geometric parameters used within. In cases of inconsistency between the geometric parameters and the shape properties, provided in the attached property, the geometric parameters take precedence.

properties.Name: ClearHeight
properties.Definition:
Clear height of the object (elevator).  
The shape information is provided in addition to the shape representation and the geometric parameters used within. In cases of inconsistency between the geometric parameters and the shape properties, provided in the attached property, the geometric parameters take precedence.

properties.Name: ColumnShoeBasePlateThickness
properties.Definition: The thickness of the column shoe base plate.

properties.Name: ColumnShoeBasePlateWidth
properties.Definition: The width of the column shoe base plate.

properties.Name: ColumnShoeBasePlateDepth
properties.Definition: The depth of the column shoe base plate.

properties.Name: ColumnShoeCasingHeight

properties.Name: ColumnShoeCasingWidth
properties.Definition: The width of the column shoe casing.

properties.Name: ColumnShoeCasingDepth
properties.Definition: The depth of the column shoe casing.

properties.Name: AnchorBoltLength
properties.Definition: The length of the anchor bolt.

properties.Name: AnchorBoltDiameter
properties.Definition: The nominal diameter of the anchor bolt bar(s).

properties.Name: AnchorBoltThreadLength
properties.Definition: The length of the threaded part of the anchor bolt.

properties.Name: AnchorBoltProtrusionLength
properties.Definition: The length of the protruding part of the anchor bolt.

properties.Name: CoolingAirFlowRate

properties.Name: HeatingAirFlowRate
properties.Definition: Heating air flow rate in the space.

properties.Name: VentilationAirFlowRate
properties.Definition: Ventilation air flow rate in the space.

properties.Name: ExhaustAirFlowRate
properties.Definition: Exhaust air flow rate in the space.

properties.Name: SpaceTemperature
properties.Definition: Temperature of the space.

properties.Name: SpaceRelativeHumidity
properties.Definition: The relative humidity of the space.

properties.Name: AcquisitionDate
properties.Definition: The date that the manufactured item was purchased.

properties.Name: BarCode
properties.Definition: The identity of the bar code given to an occurrence of the product

properties.Name: SerialNumber
properties.Definition: The serial number assigned to an occurrence of a product

properties.Name: BatchReference
properties.Definition: The identity of the batch reference from which an occurrence of a product is taken.

properties.Name: StructuralClass
properties.Definition: The structural class defined for the concrete structure (e.g. '1').

properties.Name: EnvironmentalClass
properties.Definition: The environmental class for the concrete structure (e.g. 'Y1')

properties.Name: ServiceLife
properties.Definition: Expected service life (usually measured in years)

properties.Name: LifeCycleEnvironmentalLoad
properties.Definition: Description of the life-cycle environmental load

properties.Name: DimensionalAccuracyClass
properties.Definition: Classification designation of the dimensional accuracy requirement according to local standards.

properties.Name: ConstructionToleranceClass

properties.Name: ConcreteCoverAtMainBars
properties.Definition: The protective concrete cover at the main reinforcing bars according to local building regulations.

properties.Name: ConcreteCoverAtLinks
properties.Definition: The protective concrete cover at the reinforcement links according to local building regulations.

properties.Name: Heat

properties.Name: Electricity

Note that if TRUE, it is expected that an upstand or kerb will be placed around the floor trap to prevent the ingress of surface water runoff; the provision of the upstand or kerb is not dealt with in this property set.

properties.Name: InletPatternType
properties.Definition:
Identifies the pattern of inlet connections to a trap.

A trap may have 0,1,2,3 or 4 inlet connections and the pattern of their arrangement may vary. The enumeration makes the convention that an outlet is either vertical or is placed at the bottom (south side) of the trap (when viewed in plan). Position 1 is to the left (west), position 2 is to the top (north), position 3 is to the right (east) and position 4 is to the bottom (south).

properties.Name: InletConnectionSize
properties.Definition:
Size of the inlet connection(s), where used, of the inlet connections.

Note that all inlet connections are assumed to be the same size.

properties.Name: BathType
properties.Definition:
The property enumeration defines the types of bath that may be specified within the property set where:

Domestic =	Bath, for one person at a time, into which the whole body can be easily immersed.
DomesticCorner =	Bath, for one person at a time, into which the whole body can be easily immersed and in which the immersion trough is at an angle.
Foot =	Shallow bath for washing the feet.
Jacuzzi =	Whirlpool bath for more than one person
Plunge =	Bath, usually for more than one person at a time, into which the whole body can be easily immersed.
Sitz =	Bath in which a bather sits as in a chair.
Treatment =	Bath used for hydrotherapy purposes.
Whirlpool =	Bath in which an integrated device agitates the water by pumped circulation or induction of water and/or air.
