properties.Definition: The maximum design velocity of the air in the duct or fitting.

properties.Name: AspectRatio
properties.Definition: The default aspect ratio

properties.Name: MinimumHeight
properties.Definition: The minimum duct height for rectangular, oval or round duct

properties.Name: MinimumWidth
properties.Definition: The minimum duct width for oval or rectangular duct

properties.Name: Voltage
properties.Definition: Operating voltage.

properties.Name: RealPower
properties.Definition: Real power.

properties.Name: ReactivePower
properties.Definition: Reactive power.

properties.Name: ApparentPower
properties.Definition: Apparent power.

properties.Name: PowerFactor
properties.Definition: Power factor.

properties.Name: Current
properties.Definition: Current.

properties.Name: NumberOfSections
properties.Definition:
Number of sections used in the construction of the tank

Note: All sections assumed to be the same size.

properties.Name: SectionLength
properties.Definition: The length of a section used in the construction of the tank

properties.Name: SectionWidth
properties.Definition: The width of a section used in the construction of the tank.

properties.Name: Reference
properties.Definition: Reference ID for this specified type in this project (e.g. type 'A-1')

properties.Name: Category
properties.Definition: Category of space usage or utilization of the area. It is defined according to the presiding national building code.

properties.Name: FloorCovering
properties.Definition: Label to indicate the material or finish of the space flooring. The label is used for room book information and often displayed in room stamp.

properties.Name: WallCovering
properties.Definition: Label to indicate the material or finish of the space flooring. The label is used for room book information and often displayed in room stamp.

properties.Name: CeilingCovering
properties.Definition: Label to indicate the material or finish of the space flooring. The label is used for room book information and often displayed in room stamp.

properties.Name: SkirtingBoard
properties.Definition: Label to indicate the material or construction of the skirting board around the space flooring. The label is used for room book information and often displayed in room stamp.

properties.Name: GrossPlannedArea
properties.Definition: Total planned area for the space. Used for programming the space.

properties.Name: PubliclyAccessible
properties.Definition: Indication whether this space (in case of e.g., a toilet) is designed to serve as a publicly accessible space, e.g., for a public toilet (TRUE) or not (FALSE).

properties.Name: HandicapAccessible
properties.Definition: Indication whether this space (in case of e.g., a toilet) is designed to serve as an accessible space for handicapped people, e.g., for a public toilet (TRUE) or not (FALSE). This information is often used to declare the need for access for the disabled and for special design requirements of this space.

properties.Name: ConcealedFlooring
properties.Definition: Indication whether this space is declared to be a concealed flooring (TRUE) or not (FALSE). A concealed flooring is normally meant to be the space beneath a raised floor.

properties.Name: ConcealedCeiling
properties.Definition: Indication whether this space is declared to be a concealed ceiling (TRUE) or not (FALSE). A concealed ceiling is normally meant to be the space between a slab and a suspended ceiling.

properties.Name: MaximumOutletPressure
properties.Definition: Maximum steam outlet pressure.

properties.Name: PercentageOpen
properties.Definition: The ratio between the amount that the valve is open to the full open position of the valve.

properties.Name: MeasuredFlowRate
properties.Definition: The rate of flow of a fluid measured across the valve.

properties.Name: MeasuredPressureDrop
properties.Definition: The actual pressure drop in the fluid measured across the valve.

properties.Name: IsNormallyOpen
properties.Definition: If TRUE, the valve is normally open. If FALSE is is normally closed.

properties.Name: IsolatingPurpose
properties.Definition: Defines the purpose for which the isolating valve is used since the way in which the valve is identified as an isolating valve may be in the context of its use. Note that unless there is a contextual name for the isolating valve (as in the case of a Landing Valve on a rising fire main), then the value assigned shoulkd be UNSET

properties.Name: UrinalType
properties.Definition:
Selection of the type of urinal from the enumerated list of types where:-

Bowl =	Individual wall mounted urinal
Slab =	Urinal that consists of a slab or sheet fixed to a wall and down which urinal flows into a floor channel
Stall =	Floor mounted urinal that consists of an elliptically shaped sanitary stall fixed to a wall and down which urine flows into a floor channel
Trough =	Wall mounted urinal of elongated rectangular shape on plan, that can be used by more than one person at a time.

properties.Name: UrinalMaterial
properties.Definition: Material from which the object is constructed

properties.Name: UrinalColor
properties.Definition: Color of the urinal

properties.Name: SpilloverLevel
properties.Definition: The level at which water spills out of the object

properties.Name: NominalLength
properties.Definition: Nominal or quoted length of the object.

properties.Name: NominalWidth
properties.Definition: Nominal or quoted width of the object.

properties.Name: NominalDepth
properties.Definition: Nominal or quoted depth of the object.

properties.Name: FaucetType
properties.Definition:
Defines the range of faucet types that may be specified where:

Bib =	 Faucet with a horizontal inlet and a nozzle that discharges downwards.
Globe =	 Faucet fitted through the end of a bath, with a horizontal inlet, a partially spherical body and a vertical nozzle.
Diverter =	Combination faucet assembly with a valve to enable the flow of mixed water to be transferred to a showerhead.
DividedFlowCombination =	 Combination faucet assembly in which hot and cold water are kept separate until emerging from a common nozzle
Pillar =	 Faucet that has a vertical inlet and a nozzle that discharges downwards
SingleOutletCombination =	 Combination faucet assembly in which hot and cold water mix before emerging from a common nozzle
Spray =	 Faucet with a spray outlet
SprayMixing =	 Spray faucet connected to hot and cold water supplies that delivers water at a temperature determined during use.

properties.Name: FaucetOperation
properties.Definition:
Defines the range of ways in which a faucet can be operated that may be specified where:

CeramicDisc =	 Quick action faucet with a ceramic seal to open or close the orifice
LeverHandle =	 Quick action faucet that is operated by a lever handle
NonConcussiveSelfClosing =	 Self closing faucet that does not induce surge pressure
QuarterTurn =	 Quick action faucet that can be fully opened or shut by turning the operating mechanism through 90 degrees.
QuickAction =	 Faucet that can be opened or closed fully with a single small movement of the operating mechanism
ScrewDown =	 Faucet in which a plate or disc is moved, by the rotation of a screwed spindle, to close or open the orifice.
SelfClosing =	 Faucet that is opened by pressure of the top of an operating spindle and is closed under the action of a spring or weight when the pressure is released
TimedSelfClosing = 	Self closing faucet that discharges for a predetermined period of time

properties.Name: FaucetFunction
properties.Definition: Defines the operating temperature of a faucet that may be specified.

properties.Name: Finish
properties.Definition: Description of the finish applied to the faucet

properties.Name: FaucetTopDescription
properties.Definition: Description of the operating mechanism/top of the faucet

properties.Name: Polarity
properties.Definition: Enumeration defining the polarity

properties.Name: InactiveText
properties.Definition: String value to be displayed in an inactive, off, or idle state

properties.Name: ActiveText
properties.Definition: String value to be displayed in an active, on, or running state

properties.Name: AlarmValue
properties.Definition: Enumeration defining the operating state of the control system element

properties.Name: EventEnable
properties.Definition: Enumeration that defines the type of event enabling

properties.Name: AckedTransitions
properties.Definition: Enumeration that defines the type of transition acknowledgement

properties.Name: FaceType
properties.Definition: Identifies how the terminal face of an AirTerminal is constructed.

properties.Name: Reference
properties.Definition: Reference ID for this specified type of quantity, e.g. linking back to a macro name, etc.

properties.Name: LayerQuantity

PropertyDef.Name: MaterialLayer
PropertyDef.Definition: Indication of the material layer (e.g. of a wall or slab) to which the quantity information belongs to)

PropertyDef.Name: LocalContext
PropertyDef.Definition: Local context information for the take-off quantity, if multiple information items are passed, then the property shall be indexed, e.g. LocalContext1, LocalContext2, …

properties.Definition: Quantity take-off information specific to a single layer of the element,  if multiple layer information is passed, then the property shall be indexed, e.g. LayerQuantity1, ayerQuantity2, …

properties.Name: LocalContext
properties.Definition: Local context information for the take-off quantity, if multiple information items are passed, then the property shall be indexed, e.g. LocalContext1, LocalContext2, …

properties.Name: MeanTimeBetweenFailure
properties.Definition: The average time duration between instances of failure of a product.

properties.Name: HeatRejectionRate
properties.Definition: Sum of the refrigeration effect and the heat equivalent of the power input to the compressor.

properties.Name: ExteriorHeatTransferCoefficient
properties.Definition: Exterior heat transfer coefficient associated with exterior surface area.

properties.Name: InteriorHeatTransferCoefficient
properties.Definition: Interior heat transfer coefficient associated with interior surface area.

properties.Name: RefrigrerantFoulingResistance
properties.Definition: Fouling resistance on the refrigerant side.

properties.Name: EvaporatingTemperature
properties.Definition: Refrigerant evaporating temperature.

properties.Name: LogarithmicMeanTemperatureDifference
properties.Definition: Logarithmic mean temperature difference between refrigerant and water or air.

properties.Name: UAcurves
properties.Definition: UV = f (VExterior, VInterior), UV as a function of interior and exterior fluid flow velocity at the entrance.

properties.Name: CompressorEvaporatorHeatGain
properties.Definition: Heat gain between the evaporator outlet and the compressor inlet.

properties.Name: CompressorEvaporatorPressureDrop
properties.Definition: Pressure drop between the evaporator outlet and the compressor inlet.

properties.Name: EvaporatorMeanVoidFraction
properties.Definition: Mean void fraction in evaporator.

properties.Name: WaterFoulingResistance
properties.Definition: Fouling resistance on water/air side.

properties.Name: WaterSumpTemperature
properties.Definition: Water sump temperature.

properties.Name: Effectiveness
properties.Definition: Ratio of the change in dry bulb temperature of the (primary) air stream to the difference between the entering dry bulb temperature of the (primary) air and the wet-bulb temperature of the (secondary) air.

properties.Name: SensibleHeatTransferRate
properties.Definition: Sensible heat transfer rate to primary air flow.

properties.Name: LatentHeatTransferRate
properties.Definition: Latent heat transfer rate to primary air flow.

properties.Name: TotalHeatTransferRate
properties.Definition: Total heat transfer rate to primary air flow.

properties.Name: EffectivenessTable
properties.Definition: Total heat transfer effectiveness curve as a function of the primary air flow rate.

properties.Name: AirPressureDropCurve
properties.Definition: Air pressure drop as function of air flow rate.

properties.Name: WaterPressDropCurve
properties.Definition: Water pressure drop as function of water flow rate.

properties.Name: Capacity
properties.Definition: Cooling tower capacity in terms of heat transfer rate of the cooling tower between air stream and water stream.

properties.Name: HeatTransferCoefficient
properties.Definition: Heat transfer coefficient-area product.

properties.Name: SumpHeaterPower
properties.Definition: Electrical heat power of sump heater.

properties.Name: UACurve
properties.Definition: UA value as a  function of fan speed at certain water flow rate, UA = f ( fan speed).

properties.Name: Performance
properties.Definition: Water temperature change as a function of wet-bulb temperature, water entering temperature, water flow rate, air flow rate, Tdiff = f ( Twet-bulb, Twater,in, mwater, mair).

properties.Name: ValvePattern
properties.Definition:
The configuration of the ports of a valve according to either the linear route taken by a fluid flowing through the valve or by the number of ports where:

SINGLEPORT = Valve that has a single entry port from the system that it serves, the exit port being to the surrounding environment.
ANGLED_2_PORT = Valve in which the direction of flow is changed through 90 degrees
STRAIGHT_2_PORT = Valve in which the flow is straight through
STRAIGHT_3_PORT = Valve with three separate ports
CROSSOVER_4_PORT = Valve with 4 separate ports

properties.Name: ValveOperation
properties.Definition:
The method of valve operation where:

DROPWEIGHT = A valve that is closed by the action of a weighted lever being released, the weight normally being prevented from dropping by being held by a wire, the closure normally being made by the action of heat on a fusible link in the wire
FLOAT = A valve that is opened and closed by the action of a float that rises and falls with water level. The float may be a ball attached to a lever or other mechanism
HYDRAULIC = A valve that is opened and closed by hydraulic actuation
LEVER = A valve that is opened and closed by the action of a lever rotating the gate within the valve.
LOCKSHIELD = A valve that requires the use of a special lockshield key for opening and closing, the operating mechanism being protected by a shroud during normal operation.
MOTORIZED = A valve that is opened and closed by the action of an electric motor on an actuator
PNEUMATIC = A valve that is opened and closed by pneumatic actuation
SOLENOID = A valve that is normally held open by a magnetic field in a coil acting on the gate but that is closed immediately if the electrical current generating the magnetic field is removed. 
SPRING = A valve that is normally held in position by the pressure of a spring on a plate but that may be caused to open if the pressure of the fluid is sufficient to overcome the spring pressure. 
THERMOSTATIC = A valve in which the ports are opened or closed to maintain a required predetermined temperature.
WHEEL = A valve that is opened and closed by the action of a wheel moving the gate within the valve.

properties.Name: ValveMechanism
properties.Definition:
The mechanism by which the valve function is achieved where:

BALL Valve that has a ported ball that can be turned relative to the body seat ports
BUTTERFLY Valve in which a streamlined disc pivots about a diametric axis
CONFIGUREDGATE Screwdown valve in which the closing gate is shaped in a configured manner to have a more precise control of pressure and flow change across the valve.
GLAND Valve with a tapered seating, in which a rotatable plug is retained by means of a gland and gland packing
GLOBE Screwdown valve that has a spherical body
LUBRICATEDPLUG Plug valve in which a lubricant is injected under pressure between the plug face and the body
NEEDLE Valve for regulating the flow in or from a pipe, in which a slender cone moves along the axis of flow to close against a fixed conical seat
PARALLELSLIDE Screwdown valve that has a machined plate that slides in formed grooves to form a seal
PLUG Valve that has a ported plug that can be turned relative to the body seat ports
WEDGEGATE Screwdown valve that has a wedge shaped plate fitting into tapered guides to form a seal

properties.Name: Size
properties.Definition: The size of the connection to the valve (or to each connection for faucets, mixing valves, etc.)

properties.Name: BodyMaterial
properties.Definition: Material from which the body of the valve is constructed

properties.Name: OperatingMechanismMaterial
properties.Definition: Material from which the operating mechanism (gate, globe, plug, needle, clack etc.) of the valve is constructed

properties.Name: TestPressure
properties.Definition: The maximum pressure to which the valve has been subjected under test

properties.Name: WorkingPressure
properties.Definition: The normally expected maximum working pressure of the valve

properties.Name: FlowCoefficient
properties.Definition: Flow coefficient (the quantity of fluid that passes through a fully open valve at unit pressure drop), typically expressed as the Kv or Cv value for the valve.

properties.Name: CloseOffRating
properties.Definition: Close off rating.

properties.Name: SizingMethod
properties.Definition:
Identifies whether the damper is sized nominally or with exact measurements:
NOMINAL: Nominal sizing method. 
EXACT: Exact sizing method.

properties.Name: ControlType
properties.Definition: The type of signal modification effected

properties.Name: SignalFactor1
properties.Definition: Factor (Kp)

properties.Name: SignalFactor2
properties.Definition: Factor (Ki)

properties.Name: SignalTime1
properties.Definition: Time factor used for exponential increase.

properties.Name: SignalTime2
properties.Definition: Time factor used for exponential decrease.

properties.Name: Reference
properties.Definition: Reference ID for this specified type in this project (e.g. type 'A-1')

properties.Name: Reference
properties.Definition: Reference ID for this specific instance (e.g.  'WWS/VS1/400/001', which indicates the occurrence belongs to system WWS, subsystems VSI/400, and has the component number 001)

properties.Name: GlassLayers
properties.Definition: Number of glass layers within the frame. E.g. "2" for double glazing.

properties.Name: GlassThickness1
properties.Definition: Thickness of the first (inner) glass layer.

properties.Name: GlassThickness2
properties.Definition: Thickness of the second (intermediate or outer) glass layer.

properties.Name: GlassThickness3
properties.Definition: Thickness of the third (outer) glass layer.

properties.Name: FillGas
properties.Definition: Name of the gas by which the gap between two glass layers is filled. It is given for information purposes only.

properties.Name: GlassColor
properties.Definition: Color (tint) selection for this glazing. It is given for information purposes only.

properties.Name: IsTempered
properties.Definition: Indication whether the glass is tempered (TRUE) or not (FALSE) .

properties.Name: IsLaminated
properties.Definition: Indication whether the glass is layered with other materials (TRUE) or not (FALSE).

properties.Name: IsCoated
properties.Definition: Indication whether the glass is coated with a material (TRUE) or not (FALSE).

properties.Name: IsWired
properties.Definition: Indication whether the glass includes a contained wire mesh to prevent break-in (TRUE) or not (FALSE)

properties.Name: Translucency
properties.Definition: Fraction of the visible light that passes the glazing at normal incidence. It is a value without unit.

properties.Name: Reflectivity
properties.Definition: Fraction of the visible light that is reflected by the glazing at normal incidence. It is a value without unit.

properties.Name: BeamRadiationTransmittance
properties.Definition: Direct solar radiation transmittance that passes the glazing at normal incidence. It is a value without unit, often referred to as (Tsol).

properties.Name: SolarHeatGainTransmittance
properties.Definition: Total solar heat transmittance that passes the glazing at normal incidence. It is a value without unit, often referred to as (SHGC):.

properties.Name: ThermalTransmittanceSummer
properties.Definition:
Thermal transmittance coefficient (U-Value) of a material.
Summer thermal transmittance coefficient of the glazing only, often referred to as (U-value)

properties.Name: ThermalTransmittanceWinter
properties.Definition:
Thermal transmittance coefficient (U-Value) of a material.
Winter thermal transmittance coefficient of the glazing only, often referred to as (U-value)

properties.Name: ThermometerType
properties.Definition: Identifies the means by which temperature is displayed.

properties.Name: DisplaySize
properties.Definition: The physical size of the display. In the case of a stem thermometer, this will be the length of the stem. For a dial thermometer, it will be the diameter of the dial.

properties.Name: OperationalCriteria
properties.Definition: Time of operation at maximum operational ambient air temperature.

properties.Name: MaximumDesignTemperature
properties.Definition: Maximum design operational temperature.

properties.Name: SmokeControlFlowrate
properties.Definition: Flowrate of fan while operating as a part of the smoke control system.

properties.Name: FlangeTable
properties.Definition: Designation of the standard table to which the flange conforms

properties.Name: FlangeStandard
properties.Definition: Designation of the standard describing the flange table

properties.Name: BoreSize
properties.Definition: The nominal bore of the pipe flange

properties.Name: Material
properties.Definition: Material from which the pipe flange is constructed

properties.Name: FlangeDiameter
properties.Definition: Overall diameter of the flange

properties.Name: FlangeThickness
properties.Definition: Thickness of the material from which the pipe bend is constructed

properties.Name: NumberOfBoltholes
properties.Definition: Number of boltholes in the flange

properties.Name: BoltSize
properties.Definition: Size of the bolts securing the flange

properties.Name: BoltholePitch
properties.Definition: Diameter of the circle along which the boltholes are placed

properties.Name: NumberOfActors
properties.Definition: The number of actors that are to be dealt with together in the population.

properties.Name: Category
properties.Definition: Designation of the category into which the actors in the population belong.

properties.Name: SkillLevel
properties.Definition:
Skill level exhibited by the actor and which indicates an extent of their capability to perform
                actions on the artefacts upon which they can act.

properties.Name: EnergySourceConsumption
properties.Definition: Energy consumption.

properties.Name: OperationalEfficiency
properties.Definition: Operational efficiency: boiler output divided by total energy input (electrical and fuel)

properties.Name: CombustionEfficiency
properties.Definition: Combustion efficiency under nominal condition

properties.Name: WorkingPressure
properties.Definition: Boiler working pressure

properties.Name: CombustionTemperature
properties.Definition: Average combustion chamber temperature.

properties.Name: PartLoadRatio
properties.Definition: Ratio of the real to the nominal capacity.

properties.Name: Load
properties.Definition: Boiler real load

properties.Name: PrimaryEnergyConsumption
properties.Definition: Boiler primary energy source consumption (i.e., the fuel consumed for changing the thermodynamic state of the fluid).

properties.Name: AuxiliaryEnergyConsumption
properties.Definition: Boiler secondary energy source consumption (i.e., the electricity consumed by electrical devices such as fans and pumps).

properties.Name: Description
properties.Definition: Description of the reinforcement.

properties.Name: Reference
properties.Definition: A descriptive label for the general reinforcement type.

properties.Name: XDirectionLowerBarCount
properties.Definition: The number of bars with X direction lower bar.

properties.Name: YDirectionLowerBarCount
properties.Definition: The number of bars with Y direction lower bar.

properties.Name: XDirectionUpperBarCount
properties.Definition: The number of bars with X direction upper bar.

properties.Name: YDirectionUpperBarCount
properties.Definition: The number of bars with Y direction upper bar.

properties.Name: DiagonalTrussHeight
properties.Definition: The overall height of the truss connector.

properties.Name: DiagonalTrussLength
properties.Definition: The overall length of the truss connector.

properties.Name: DiagonalTrussCrossBarSpacing
properties.Definition: The spacing between diagonal cross-bar sections.

properties.Name: DiagonalTrussBaseBarDiameter
properties.Definition: The nominal diameter of the base bar.

properties.Name: DiagonalTrussSecondaryBarDiameter
properties.Definition: The nominal diameter of the secondary bar.

properties.Name: DiagonalTrussCrossBarDiameter
properties.Definition: The nominal diameter of the diagonal cross-bars.

properties.Name: MixerControl
properties.Definition: Defines the form of control of the mixing valve.

properties.Name: OutletConnectionSize
properties.Definition: The size of the pipework connection from the mixing valve.

properties.Name: CisternHeight
properties.Definition: Enumeration that identifies the height of the cistern or, if set to 'None' if the urinal has no cistern and is flushed using mains or high pressure water through a flushing valve.

properties.Name: CisternCapacity
properties.Definition: Volumetric capacity of the cistern

properties.Name: IsSingleFlush
properties.Definition: Indicates whether the cistern is single flush = TRUE (i.e. the same amount of water is used for each and every flush) or dual flush = FALSE (i.e. the amount of water used for a flush may be selected by the user to be high or low depending on the waste material to be removed)

properties.Name: FlushType
properties.Definition:
The property enumeration Pset_FlushTypeEnum defines the types of flushing mechanism that may be specified for cisterns and sanitary terminals where:-

Lever =	Flushing is achieved by twisting a lever that causes a predetermined flow of water to be passed from a cistern to the sanitary terminal.
Pull =	Flushing is achieved by pulling a handle or knob vertically upwards that causes a predetermined flow of water to be passed from a cistern to the sanitary terminal.
Push =	Flushing is achieved by pushing a button or plate that causes a predetermined flow of water to be passed from a cistern to the sanitary terminal.
Sensor = Flush is activated through an automatic sensing mechanism.

properties.Name: FlushRate
properties.Definition: The minimum and maximum volume of water used at each flush. Where a single flush is used, the value of upper bound and lower bound should be equal. For a dual flush toilet, the lower bound should be used for the lesser flush rate and the upper bound for the greater flush rate. Where flush is achieved using mains pressure water through a flush valve, the value of upper and lower bound should be equal and should be the same as the flush rate property of the flush valve (see relevant valve property set). Alternatively, in this case, do not assert the flush rate property; refer to the flush rate of the flush valve.

properties.Name: IsAutomaticFlush
properties.Definition: Boolean value that determines if the cistern is flushed automatically either after each use or periodically (TRUE) or whether manual flushing is required (FALSE)

properties.Name: CisternMaterial
properties.Definition: Material from which the object is constructed

properties.Name: CisternColor
properties.Definition: Color of the object

properties.Name: HasSoundAttentuation
properties.Definition: TRUE if the coil has sound attenuation, FALSE if it does not.

properties.Name: SeatingHeight
properties.Definition: The value of seating height if the chair height is not adjustable.

properties.Name: HighestSeatingHeight
properties.Definition: The value of seating height of high level if the chair height is adjustable.

properties.Name: LowestSeatingHeight
properties.Definition: The value of seating height of low level if the chair height is adjustable.

properties.Name: IsMain
properties.Definition: Identifies if the current instance is a main distribution point or topmost level in an electrical distribution hierarchy (= TRUE) or a sub-main distribution point (= FALSE).

properties.Name: NumberOfDoors
properties.Definition: Number of doors

properties.Name: CaseMaterial
properties.Definition: Material from which the casing surrounding the distribution point is constructed.

properties.Name: CaseWeight
properties.Definition: Weight of case

properties.Name: NumberOfOpenings
properties.Definition: Maximum number of openings that can fit with the case for normal use. In the openings there must be nipples, so cable may run through.

properties.Name: Sensitivity
properties.Definition: Current leakage to an unwanted leading path during normal operation (IEC 151-14-49)

properties.Name: Description
properties.Definition: Description of the reinforcement.

properties.Name: Reference
properties.Definition: A descriptive label for the general reinforcement type.

properties.Name: BarAllocationType
properties.Definition: Defines the type of the reinforcement bar allocation.

properties.Name: VerticalBarPitch
properties.Definition: The pitch length of the vertical bar.

properties.Name: HorizontalBarPitch
properties.Definition: The pitch length of the horizontal bar.

properties.Name: SpacingBarPitch
properties.Definition: The pitch length of the spacing bar.

properties.Name: WithLock
properties.Definition: Indicates whether the file cabinet is lockable (= TRUE) or not (= FALSE).

properties.Name: Reference
properties.Definition: Reference ID for this specified type in this project (e.g. type 'A-1')

properties.Name: Height
properties.Definition:
Height of the object. It is the upper hight of the railing above the floor or stair.
The size information is provided in addition to the shape representation and the geometric parameters used within. In cases of inconsistency between the geometric parameters and the size properties, provided in the attached property set, the geometric parameters take precedence.

properties.Name: Diameter
properties.Definition:
Diameter of the object. It is the diameter of the handrail of the railing.
The size information is provided in addition to the shape representation and the geometric parameters used within. In cases of inconsistency between the geometric parameters and the size properties, provided in the attached property set, the geometric parameters take precedence.
Here the diameter of the hand or guardrail within the railing.

properties.Name: IsExternal
properties.Definition: Indication whether the element is designed for use in the exterior (TRUE) or not (FALSE). If (TRUE) it is an external element and faces the outside of the building.

properties.Name: ExternalShadingCoefficient
properties.Definition: Radiation transmission coefficient of the outside shading device. It is a value without unit.

properties.Name: InternalShadingCoefficient
properties.Definition: Radiation transmission coefficient of the inside shading device, symbol "b-value". It is a value without unit.

properties.Name: InsetShadingCoefficient
properties.Definition: Radiation transmission coefficient of the shading device inside the glazing, symbol "b-value". It is a value without unit.

properties.Name: ControlType
properties.Definition: The type of signal modification effected

properties.Name: BandWidth
properties.Definition: Dead band for controller

properties.Name: Reference
properties.Definition: Reference ID for this specified type in this project (e.g. type 'A-1')

properties.Name: FireExit
properties.Definition:
Indication whether this object is designed to serve as an exit in the case of fire (TRUE) or not (FALSE).
Here whether the transport element (in case of e.g., a lift) is designed to serve as a fire exit, e.g., for fire escape purposes.

properties.Name: PowerSource
properties.Definition: Type of power driving the compressor

properties.Name: RefrigerantClass
properties.Definition:
Refrigerant class used by the compressor.
CFC: Chlorofluorocarbons.
HCFC: Hydrochlorofluorocarbons.
HFC: Hydrofluorocarbons.

properties.Name: RefrigerantType
properties.Definition: Refrigerant material.

properties.Name: MinimumPartLoadRatio
properties.Definition: Minimum part load ratio as a fraction of nominal capacity.

properties.Name: MaximumPartLoadRatio
properties.Definition: Maximum part load ratio as a fraction of nominal capacity.

properties.Name: CompressorSpeed
properties.Definition: Compressor speed

properties.Name: NominalCapacity
properties.Definition: Compressor nameplate capacity.

properties.Name: IdealCapacity
properties.Definition: Compressor capacity under ideal conditions.

properties.Name: IdealShaftPower
properties.Definition: Compressor shaft power under ideal conditions.

properties.Name: HasHotGasBypass
properties.Definition: Whether or not hot gas bypass is provided for the compressor. TRUE = Yes, FALSE = No.

properties.Name: FormSurface

PropertyDef.Name: FormSurfaceClass
PropertyDef.Definition:
Classification designation for the formwork surface according to local standards,
                            e.g. E, 1, 2, or 3.

PropertyDef.Name: FormSurfaceTextureDescription
PropertyDef.Definition:
Textual description of the form surface texture pattern. Used only if the form work
                            includes sub-areas with textures.

PropertyDef.Name: FormSurfaceArea
PropertyDef.Definition:
The form surface area quantity for which the particular form surface finish and
                            possibly texture type is defined. Usually expressed in square meter (m2).

properties.Definition:
Formwork surface area quantity. Several complex properties of this type may be attached to this
                Pset, one for each formwork subsurface with different properties.

properties.Name: ExternalSurface

PropertyDef.Name: ExternalSurfaceType
PropertyDef.Definition:
Type designation for the surface. Typical surface treatments include: hewing, acid
                            treatment, brushing, sand blasting, grinding, sanding, painting, cleansing, parging, roller
                            application, and different kinds of tile cladding, e.g. bricks, brick tiles, clinker and
                            mosaic tiles, etc.

PropertyDef.Name: ExternalSurfaceClass
PropertyDef.Definition:
Class designation for the surface. This usually depends on what kind of surface type
                            is used and how the classification is expressed in local standards.

PropertyDef.Name: ExternalSurfaceArea
PropertyDef.Definition:
The external surface area quantity for which the particular surface finish is
                            defined. Usually expressed in square meter (m2).

properties.Definition:
External surface area quantity.Several complex properties of this type may be attached to this
                Pset, one for each external subsurface with different properties

properties.Name: SurfaceDescriptionDocReference
properties.Definition:
Reference to an external document describing the details of the surface of the concrete element,
                i.e. a drawing or textual document file.

properties.Name: LightSensorSetPoint
properties.Definition: The illuminance value to be sensed.

properties.Name: LightSensorRange
properties.Definition: The upper and lower bounds for operation of the light sensor.

properties.Name: LightSensorAccuracy
properties.Definition: The accuracy of the sensor.

properties.Name: TimeConstant
properties.Definition:
The time constant of the sensor.
.

properties.Name: Capacity
properties.Definition: The product of the  ideal capacity and the overall volumetric efficiency of the compressor.

properties.Name: EnergyEfficiencyRatio
properties.Definition: Energy efficiency ratio (EER).

properties.Name: CoefficientOfPerformance
properties.Definition: Coefficient of performance (COP).

properties.Name: CapacityCurve
properties.Definition: Chiller cooling capacity is a function of condensing temperature and evaporating temperature, data is in table form, Capacity = f (TempCon, TempEvp), capacity = a1+b1*Tei+c1*Tei^2+d1*Tci+e1*Tci^2+f1*Tei*Tci.

properties.Name: CoefficientOfPerformanceCurve
properties.Definition: Chiller coefficient of performance (COP) is function of condensing temperature and evaporating temperature, data is in table form,  COP= f (TempCon, TempEvp),  COP = a2+b2*Tei+c2*Tei^2+d2*Tci+e2*Tci^2+f2*Tei*Tci

properties.Name: FullLoadRatioCurve
properties.Definition: Ratio of actual power to full load power as a quadratic function of part load, at certain condensing and evaporating temperature, FracFullLoadPower = f ( PartLoadRatio).

properties.Name: Description
properties.Definition: Description of the reinforcement.

properties.Name: Reference
properties.Definition: A descriptive label for the general reinforcement type.

properties.Name: LongOutsideTopBarPitch
properties.Definition: The pitch length of the long outside top bar.

properties.Name: LongInsideCenterTopBarPitch
properties.Definition: The pitch length of the long inside center top bar.

properties.Name: LongInsideEndTopBarPitch
properties.Definition: The pitch length of the long inside end top bar.

properties.Name: ShortOutsideTopBarPitch
properties.Definition: The pitch length of the short outside top bar.

properties.Name: ShortInsideCenterTopBarPitch
properties.Definition: The pitch length of the short inside center top bar.

properties.Name: ShortInsideEndTopBarPitch
properties.Definition: The pitch length of the short inside end top bar.

properties.Name: LongOutsideLowerBarPitch
properties.Definition: The pitch length of the long outside lower bar.

properties.Name: LongInsideCenterLowerBarPitch
properties.Definition: The pitch length of the long inside center lower bar.

properties.Name: LongInsideEndLowerBarPitch
properties.Definition: The pitch length of the long inside end lower bar.

properties.Name: ShortOutsideLowerBarPitch
properties.Definition: The pitch length of the short outside lower bar.

properties.Name: ShortInsideCenterLowerBarPitch
properties.Definition: The pitch length of the short inside center lower bar.

properties.Name: ShortInsideEndLowerBarPitch
properties.Definition: The pitch length of the short inside end lower bar.

properties.Name: EdgeFixingPlateLength
properties.Definition: The length of the L-shaped edge plate.

properties.Name: EdgeFixingPlateThickness
properties.Definition: The thickness of the L-shaped edge plate.

properties.Name: EdgeFixingPlateFlangeWidthInPlaneZ
properties.Definition: The flange width of the L-shaped edge plate in plane Z.

properties.Name: EdgeFixingPlateFlangeWidthInPlaneX
properties.Definition: The flange width of the L-shaped edge plate in plane X.

properties.Name: HandicapAccessible
properties.Definition:
Indication that this object is designed to be accessible by the handicapped. 
It is giving according to the requirements of the national building code.

properties.Name: ParkingUse
properties.Definition: Identifies the type of transporation for which the parking space is designed. Values are not predefined but might include car, compact car, motorcycle, bicycle, truck, bus etc.

properties.Name: ParkingUnits
properties.Definition: Indicates the number of transporation units of the type specified by the property ParkingUse that may be accommodated within the space. Generally, this value should default to 1 unit. However, where the parking space is for motorcycles or bicycles, provision may be made for more than one unit in the space.

properties.Name: EarthFailureDeviceType
Sensitivity
properties.Definition: Current leakage to an unwanted leading path during normal operation (IEC 151-14-49)

properties.Name: RefrigerantClass
properties.Definition:
Refrigerant class used by the condenser.
CFC: Chlorofluorocarbons.
HCFC: Hydrochlorofluorocarbons.
HFC: Hydrofluorocarbons.

properties.Name: RefrigerantType
properties.Definition: Refrigerant material.

properties.Name: ExternalSurfaceArea
properties.Definition: External surface area (both primary and secondary area).

properties.Name: InternalSurfaceArea
properties.Definition: Internal surface area.

properties.Name: InternalRefrigerantVolume
properties.Definition: Internal volume of condenser (refrigerant side).

properties.Name: InternalWaterVolume
properties.Definition: Internal volume of condenser (water side).

properties.Name: NominalHeatTransferArea
properties.Definition: Nominal heat transfer surface area associated with nominal overall heat transfer coefficient.

properties.Name: NominalHeatTransferCoefficient
properties.Definition: Nominal overall heat transfer coefficient associated with nominal heat transfer area.

properties.Name: IsDesignPoint
properties.Definition: Indicates whether an instance of IfcDistributionPort is to act as the design point for sprinkler hydraulic calculation (set TRUE) or not (either set FALSE or assumed to be FALSE where an instance of the property set is not assigned to an instance of IfcDistributionPort).

properties.Name: Shape
properties.Definition: Shape of the air terminal. Slot is typically a long narrow supply device with an aspect ratio generally greater than 10 to 1.

properties.Name: FlowPattern
properties.Definition: Flow pattern

properties.Name: AirFlowrateRange
properties.Definition: Air flowrate range within which the air terminal is designed to operate.

properties.Name: TemperatureRange
properties.Definition: Temperature range within which the air terminal is designed to operate.

properties.Name: DischargeDirection
properties.Definition:
Discharge direction of the air terminal.
Parallel: discharges parallel to mounting surface designed so that flow attaches to the surface.
Perpendicular:  discharges away from mounting surface.
Adjustable: both parallel and perpendicular discharge.

properties.Name: ThrowLength
properties.Definition: The horizontal or vertical axial distance an airstream travels after leaving an AirTerminal before the maximum stream velocity is reduced to a specified terminal velocity under isothermal conditions at the upper value of the AirFlowrateRange.

properties.Name: AirDiffusionPerformanceIndex
properties.Definition: The Air Diffusion Performance Index (ADPI) is used for cooling mode conditions. If several measurements of air velocity and air temperature are made throughout the occupied zone of a space, the ADPI is the percentage of locations where measurements were taken that meet the specifications for effective draft temperature and air velocity.

properties.Name: Material
properties.Definition: The primary material used to construct the air terminal.

properties.Name: FinishType
properties.Definition: The type of finish for the air terminal.

properties.Name: FinishColor
properties.Definition: The finish color for the air terminal.

properties.Name: MountingType
properties.Definition:
The way the air terminal is mounted to the ceiling, wall, etc.
Surface type is mounted to the surface of something (e.g., wall, duct, etc.).
Flat flush type is mounted flat and flush with a surface.
Lay-in type is mounted in a lay-in type ceiling (e.g., a dropped ceiling grid).

properties.Name: CoreType
properties.Definition: Identifies the way the core of the AirTerminal is constructed.

properties.Name: CoreSetHorizontal
properties.Definition: Degree of horizontal (in the X-axis of the LocalPlacement) blade set from the centerline.

properties.Name: CoreSetVertical
properties.Definition: Degree of vertical (in the Y-axis of the LocalPlacement) blade set from the centerline.

properties.Name: HasIntegralControl
properties.Definition: If TRUE, a self powered temperature control is included in the AirTerminal.

properties.Name: FlowControlType
properties.Definition: Type of flow control element that may be included as a part of the construction of the air terminal.

properties.Name: HasSoundAttenuator
properties.Definition: If TRUE, the air terminal has sound attenuation.

properties.Name: HasThermalInsulation
properties.Definition: If TRUE, the air terminal has thermal insulation.

properties.Name: NeckArea
properties.Definition: Neck area of the air terminal.

properties.Name: EffectiveArea
properties.Definition: Effective discharge area of the air terminal.

properties.Name: Weight
properties.Definition: Weight of the air terminal.

properties.Name: AirFlowrateVersusFlowControlElement
properties.Definition: Air flowrate versus flow control element position at nominal pressure drop.

properties.Name: Length
properties.Definition: The length of the sump.

properties.Name: Width
properties.Definition: The width of the sump.

properties.Name: InvertLevel
properties.Definition: The lowest point in the cross section of the sump.

properties.Name: NumberOfStates
properties.Definition: Number of states for the multi-state Input.

properties.Name: StateText
properties.Definition: String values to identify the state condition. Upper limit of the list is equal to the NumberOfStates.

properties.Name: AlarmValues
properties.Definition: Specifies any states the present value must equal before an EventEnable shall occur. Upper limit of the list is equal to the NumberOfStates.

properties.Name: EventEnable
properties.Definition: Enumeration that defines the type of event enabling

properties.Name: NotifyType
properties.Definition: Enumeration that defines the notification type

properties.Name: HeatOutputPerUnitArea
properties.Definition: The amount of heat output per unit area of heat emitter.

properties.Name: CrossSectionalArea
properties.Definition: Cross section area of the phase(s) lead(s)

properties.Name: NominalLength
properties.Definition: The nominal length of a conductor.

properties.Name: ElectricalConductorFunction
properties.Definition: Type of function for which the conductor is intended.

properties.Name: PhaseReference
properties.Definition: The phase identification used when the function of the conductor is a phase. In general, it is recommended that IEC recommendations for phase identification are used (L1, L2 etc.). However, other phase identifiers may be used such as by color (Red, Blue, Yellow) or by number (1, 2, 3) etc.

properties.Name: ConductorMaterial
properties.Definition: Type of material from which the conductor is constructed. Such as Aluminium or Copper

properties.Name: ConductorSheathMaterial
properties.Definition: The material from which the sheath or insulation is constructed. Such as EPR, Copper, MICC, PVC, PEX, Rubber, XPLE, XPLE_LS. Note that materials used should be agreed between exchange participants before use.

properties.Name: MaximumOperatingTemperature
properties.Definition: The maximum temperature at which the sheath retains its integrity.

properties.Name: IsFireResistant
properties.Definition: Indication of whether the sheath is fire resistant (= TRUE) or not (= FALSE).

properties.Name: SheathColor
properties.Definition: Colour code on cable, conductor.

properties.Name: Force
properties.Definition: Indicates the maximum close-off force for the actuator.

properties.Name: Stroke
properties.Definition: Indicates the maximum distance the actuator must traverse.

properties.Name: ChamberLengthOrRadius
properties.Definition: Length or, in the event of the shape being circular in plan, the radius of the chamber.

properties.Name: ChamberWidth
properties.Definition: Width, in the event of the shape being non circular in plan.

properties.Name: WallMaterial
properties.Definition:
The material from which the wall of the chamber is constructed.
NOTE: It is assumed that chamber walls will be constructed of a single material.

properties.Name: WallThickness
properties.Definition:
The thickness of the chamber wall construction
NOTE: It is assumed that chamber walls will be constructed at a single thickness.

properties.Name: BaseMaterial
properties.Definition:
The material from which the base of the chamber is constructed.
NOTE: It is assumed that chamber base will be constructed of a single material.

properties.Name: BaseThickness
properties.Definition:
The thickness of the chamber base construction
NOTE: It is assumed that chamber base will be constructed at a single thickness.

properties.Name: AccessCoverMaterial
properties.Definition:
The material from which the access cover to the chamber is constructed.
NOTE: It is assumed that chamber walls will be constructed of a single material.

properties.Name: SwitchOperation
properties.Definition: Indicates operation of emergency stop switch.

properties.Name: Reference
properties.Definition: Reference ID for this specified type in this project (e.g. type 'A-1')

properties.Name: RequiredHeadroom
properties.Definition: Required headroom clearance for the passageway according to the applicable building code or additional requirements.

properties.Name: RequiredSlope
properties.Definition:
Required sloping angle of the object  - relative to horizontal (0.0 degrees).
Required maximum slope for the passageway according to the applicable building code or additional requirements

properties.Name: IsExternal
properties.Definition: Indication whether the element is designed for use in the exterior (TRUE) or not (FALSE). If (TRUE) it is an external element and faces the outside of the building.

properties.Name: FireRating
properties.Definition:
Fire rating for this object.
It is given according to the national fire safety classification.

properties.Name: FireExit
properties.Definition:
Indication whether this object is designed to serve as an exit in the case of fire (TRUE) or not (FALSE).
Here it defines an exit ramp in accordance to the national building code.

properties.Name: HandicapAccessible
properties.Definition:
Indication that this object is designed to be accessible by the handicapped. 
Set to (TRUE) if this ramp is rated as handicap accessible  according the local building codes, otherwise (FALSE).

properties.Name: HasNonSkidSurface
properties.Definition: Indication whether the surface finish is designed to prevent slippery (TRUE) or not (FALSE).

properties.Name: Reference
properties.Definition: Reference ID for this specified type in this project (e.g. type 'A-1')

properties.Name: NumberOfRiser
properties.Definition: Total number of the risers included in the stair

properties.Name: NumberOfTreads
properties.Definition: Total number of treads included in the stair

properties.Name: RiserHeight
properties.Definition:
Vertical distance from tread to tread. 
The riser height is supposed to be equal for all steps of a stair or stair flight.

properties.Name: TreadLength
properties.Definition:
Horizontal distance from the front of the thread to the front of the next tread. 
The tread length is supposed to be equal for all steps of the stair or stair flight at the walking line.

properties.Name: RequiredHeadroom
properties.Definition: Required headroom clearance for the passageway according to the applicable building code or additional requirements

properties.Name: HandicapAccessible
properties.Definition:
Indication that this object is designed to be accessible by the handicapped. 
Set to (TRUE) if this stair is rated as handicap accessible  according the local building codes, otherwise (FALSE). Accessibility maybe provided by additional means.

properties.Name: IsExternal
properties.Definition: Indication whether the element is designed for use in the exterior (TRUE) or not (FALSE). If (TRUE) it is an external element and faces the outside of the building.

properties.Name: FireRating
properties.Definition:
Fire rating for this object.
It is given according to the national fire safety classification.

properties.Name: FireExit
properties.Definition:
Indication whether this object is designed to serve as an exit in the case of fire (TRUE) or not (FALSE).
Here it defines an exit stair in accordance to the national building code.

properties.Name: HasNonSkidSurface
properties.Definition: Indication whether the surface finish is designed to prevent slippery (TRUE) or not (FALSE).

properties.Name: PortNumber
properties.Definition: The index of the port as it relates to the related object. Each index must be unique for any given related object.

properties.Name: ConnectionType
properties.Definition:
The end-style treatment of the pipe port:
BRAZED: Brazed. 
COMPRESSION: Compression. 
FLANGED: Flanged. 
GROOVED: Grooved. 
OUTSIDESLEEVE: Outside Sleeve. 
SOLDERED: Soldered. 
SWEDGE: Swedge. 
THREADED: Threaded. 
WELDED: Welded. 
OTHER: Another type of end-style has been applied.
NONE: No end-style has been applied.
USERDEFINED: User-defined port connection type. 
NOTDEFINED: Undefined port connection type.

properties.Name: InputPressure
properties.Definition: Maximum design pressure for the actuator.

properties.Name: InputFlowrate
properties.Definition: Maximum hydraulic flowrate requirement.

properties.Name: ActuatorInputPower
properties.Definition: Maximum input power requirement

properties.Name: ElectricActuatorType
properties.Definition: Enumeration that identifies electric actuator as defined by its operational principle.

properties.Name: SeatType
properties.Definition:
The property enumeration Pset_ToiletSeatTypeEnum defines the types of seat that may be attached to the toilet pan and specified within the property set Pset_Toilet where:-

Extension =	WC seat that is attached at the back, by means of side or top hinges, to a flat piece of material secured to the water closet pan
Inset =	Seat that consists of pads of impervious material fixed to the top of a water closet pan
OpenFrontSeat =	Hinged WC seat shaped like a horseshoe with the gap at the front
RingSeat =	WC seat in the shape of a ring
SelfRaising =	WC seat with balanced weights or springs to raise it when not in use
None =	There is no seat attached to the water closet pan

properties.Name: SeatHasCover
properties.Definition: Indicates whether there is a cover associated with the toilet seat

properties.Name: SeatMaterial
properties.Definition: Material from which the object is constructed

properties.Name: SeatColor
properties.Definition: Color of the object

properties.Name: PortNumber
properties.Definition: The index of the port as it relates to the related object. Each index must be unique for any given related object.

properties.Name: ConnectionType
properties.Definition:
The end-style treatment of the duct port:
BEADEDSLEEVE: Beaded Sleeve. 
COMPRESSION: Compression. 
CRIMP: Crimp. 
DRAWBAND: Drawband. 
DRIVESLIP: Drive slip. 
FLANGED: Flanged. 
OUTSIDESLEEVE: Outside Sleeve. 
SLIPON: Slipon. 
SOLDERED: Soldered. 
SSLIP: S-Slip. 
STANDINGSEAM: Standing seam. 
SWEDGE: Swedge. 
WELDED: Welded. 
OTHER: Another type of end-style has been applied.
NONE: No end-style has been applied.

properties.Name: MechanicalEfficiency
properties.Definition: The pumps operational mechanical efficiency.

properties.Name: OverallEfficiency
properties.Definition: The pump and motor overall operational efficiency.

properties.Name: PressureRise
properties.Definition: The developed pressure.

properties.Name: RotationSpeed
properties.Definition: Pump rotational speed.

properties.Name: Flowrate
properties.Definition: The actual operational fluid flowrate.

properties.Name: Power
properties.Definition: The actual power consumption of the pump.
